115979412015170.description:
Join us at Arts Court on Monday May 5th for an inspiring night of live competitive painting! 

Featured Artists:

Kate Aley
Stephen Shugar
Sophie Nicholas
Laurraine Nzam
Ame Papatsie
Kristina Corre
Peter Purdy
Atallia Burke
Karine Gascon
Gloria Bay
Kate Domina

12 professional and emerging painters will compete to become the next Art Battle champion, the winner earning a cash prize and a spot in the Ottawa Championship in June 2014. The winner of the Ottawa Final will compete in the 2014 National Championship. The painters and audiences have been absolutely amazing in Canada's Capital and we can't wait to be back at the easels on Monday May 5th.

To paint with Art Battle in Ottawa or another city, please visit our application page at http://artbattle.ca/register

Congratulations to Omar Hopkinson, winner of March's Art Battle 111! We'll see Oms and the other champs from this season at the Ottawa Finals in late June.

Our promotional partners, the AOE Arts Council (AOE) have been serving the Ottawa arts community for 25 years. AOE represents a bilingual membership of over 450 artists, organizations and supporters. Visit www.artsoe.ca to learn more.

WHAT IS ART BATTLE?

Art Battle is live competitive painting. Painters create the best work they can in 20 minutes. As they work, patrons move around the easels, closely watching the creative process. The medium is acrylic paint and the tools allowed are brushes, palette knives or any non-mechanical implements. At the end of the round, the audience votes democratically for their favourite painting and bids in silent auction to take the work home. This is Art Battle Canada’s 5th season and first full season in Ottawa.

Art Battle 120
Monday, May 5th, 7pm
Arts Court, 2 Daly Ave
Tickets 15$ door/10$ Limited Advance online
$10 at the door for Students and Seniors
115979412015170.name: Art Battle 120 - Ottawa

1350249431783152.description:
On November 4, 2008 Proposition 8 passed in California, amending the state Constitution to ban same-sex marriage. The defeat provoked a groundswell of initiative within the GLBT community at a grassroots level, with many new political and protest organizations being formed in response. 

The NOH8 Campaign is a photographic silent protest created by celebrity photographer Adam Bouska (http://www.bouska.net) and partner Jeff Parshley in direct response to the passage of Proposition 8. Photos feature subjects with duct tape over their mouths, symbolizing their voices being silenced by Prop 8 and similar legislation around the world, with "NOH8" painted on one cheek in protest.


Five years since its inception, the NOH8 Campaign has grown to nearly 33,000 faces and continues to grow at an exponential rate. The campaign began with portraits of everyday Californians from all walks of life and soon rose to include politicians, military personnel, newlyweds, law enforcement, artists, celebrities, and many more. 

The NOH8 Campaign has received overwhelming support from around the world, and has appeared in various local and national news programs and publications. The images are widely used on various social networking sites such as Facebook and Twitter to spread the message of equality.

TO PARTCIPATE, "like" and "share" this event. Once we have enough people we will confirm with Adam Bouska and tell him how proud we are in the Nations Capital to help on this awesome campaign.

Thank you all for your support
1350249431783152.name: NOH8 Campaign in Ottawa, Ontario - Canada

TICKETS GO ON SALE APRIL 22 AT NOON and can be purchased online at www.centrepointetheatre.com, via our call centre at 613-580-2700, toll free 1-866-752-5231 or in person at Centrepointe Theatre’s box office at 101 Centrepointe Drive or Shenkman Arts Centre guest services at 245 Centrum Blvd.  

The awe-inspiring James Van Praagh bridges the gap between two planes of existence, that of the living and that of the dead by providing evidential proof of life after death via detailed messages.

Prices:
V.I.P includes Meet & Greet $120 
Gold $85 
Silver $60 
General $45

**All Prices plus tax and Service Charge**

Van Praagh’s popularity began in the early ‘90s, on the NBC morning talk show “The Other Side.” He went on to author # 1 NY Times Best- selling books such as Ghosts Among Us, Talking to Heaven, Reaching to Heaven and Healing Grief. For five seasons, Van Praagh was the co-executive producer of CBS’s #1 drama “Ghost Whisper” starring Jennifer Love Hewitt. Van Praagh's message of hope has touched a great many people due to his television appearances on such shows as Oprah, Larry King Live, 20/20, 48 Hours, Chelsea Lately and A&E Biography. You will be amazed when you see James select people for the audience to participate in the calling of spirits. Be sure to purchase your tickets early because this one-night-only event will definitely sell out.  

During the 3-hour event you will enjoy:

 • Discovering the process of mediumship;
 • A guided healing and enlightened group meditation; and
 • Random messages given to audience members from guides, family and friends in spirit.
1382082895371837.name: James Van Praagh in Ottawa

1383980908546764.description:
(Version en français suit après)
The political economies of Latin American have undergone important changes in the past twenty years integrating certain territories and sectors of the population while marginalizing others. Since the beginning of the 2000s, the region is in a transition from neoliberalism towards neo-developmentism involving resource extraction, the development of new knowledge and state-led initiatives.
This year’s conference aims to examine the contradictions, opportunities and consequences that have emerged in the past few years to promote discussion on topics such as:
- development and resource extraction,
- indigenous and gender issues, 
- human rights, 
- social movements, 
- citizenship, democracy and governance,
- public policy and programs,
- regional integration projects (e.g. ALBA, CELAC, MERCOSUR),
- Canada's role in the region,
- culture, religion, and identities.
This conference is organized by a multi-disciplinary committee of graduate students from the University of Ottawa, Carleton University, and the Université du Québec en Outaouais (UQO).
The inscription fees are 10 $CAD for students.

VERSION EN FRANÇAIS:

Depuis les vingt dernières années, les transformations au niveau de l’économie politique des pays d’Amérique latine ont conduit à l’intégration de certains secteurs de la population et des territoires, mais également à la marginalisation d’autres secteurs. Le passage du néolibéralisme vers un néo-développementalisme axé sur l’extraction des ressources naturelles
ainsi que le développement de nouvelles connaissances et de nouvelles initiatives gouvernementales caractérisent une Amérique latine qui est présentement en transition.
La conférence de cette année vise à examiner les contradictions, possibilités et conséquences ayant émergé au courant des
 dernières années afin d’encourager des discussions sur des enjeux tels que :
- le développement et l’extraction des ressources naturelles,
- les enjeux relatifs aux autochtones,
- la question du genre,
- les droits humains,
- les mouvements sociaux,
- la citoyenneté, la démocratie et la gouvernance,
- les programmes et politiques publiques, les projets d’intégration régionale (par exemple l’ALBA, la CELAC, le MERCOSUR),
- le rôle du Canada dans la région,
- la culture, la religion et les identités.

La Conférence sur l’Amérique latine et les Caraïbes de 2014 est organisée par un comité multidisciplinaire d’étudiants diplômés venant de l’Université d’Ottawa, de l’Université Carleton et de l’Université du Québec en Outaouais (UQO).
Le coût d'inscription est de 10$CAD.

The/Le PROGRAMME:

Jeudi le 17 avril / Thursday - April 17th, 
18h Bienvenue du Vice Recteur de l'Université du Québec en Outaouais, Denis Harrisson/Welcoming remarks by the authorities of the University of Quebec.
18:05h Bienvenue du représentant de l'Ambassade de Mexique/Welcoming remarks by the representative of the Embassy of
Mexico: Soileh Padilla Mayer, Encargada De Asuntos Culturales, Tercera Secretaria.
18:10h Cinema: "Las buenas hierbas", "The Good Herbs" Drama. 2010, 120 min Dirección: María Novaro

Vendredi le 18 avril / Friday - April 18th, 9h-11h
PANEL / SESSION 1 : QUESTIONS MINIÈRES EN AMÉRIQUE LATINE / MINING ISSUES IN LATIN AMERICA
President / Discussant: Karine Vanthuyne, Université d'Ottawa 
1. Marie-Dominik Langlois, Étudiante de maîtrise en sciences politiques, UQAM : Les enjeux identitaires autochtones du peuple Xinka en lien avec la défense du droit au consentement et avec leur participation politique par rapport au projet minier Escobal au Guatemala.
2. Marie-Josée Massicotte, Professeure en sciences politiques, l'Université d'Ottawa : Indigenous communities of Oaxaca in defence of territorial and cultural integrity : luchas cotidianas contra la mina y por la vida.
3. Anahy Gajardo, Université de Neuchâtel et l'Université McGill : « Poussière des mines et cendres de l’ethnicité» : Rôles et impacts du projet d’extraction minière Pascua Lama sur le processus de (re)construction de l’autochtonie diaguita"
4. Daniel Tubb, Ph.D. Political Science candidate, Carleton University: Fictitious Mining: Gold in the Chocó (Colombia)

PANEL / SESSION 2 : GENRE ET DÉVELOPPEMENT /GENDER AND DEVELOPMENT
1. Ariane Martin, Étudiante à la maîtrise en mondialisation et développement international avec spécialisation en études des femmes à l’Université d’Ottawa : Le développement durable social: un outil de promotion de l’égalité entre les femmes et les hommes à la Martinique.
2. Denyse Côté, Professeure en travail social, Université du Québec en Outaouais : Intervention auprès des femmes victimes de catastrophes : l’expérience haïtienne.
3. Jaime Antonio Hidalgo, MA Candidate, School of International Development and Global Studies, University of Ottawa: Agricultural Production and Labour in the Prison Farms of El Salvador.

11h15-13h
PANEL / SESSION 3 : Macro and Micro Economic Development in Latin America
1. Gustavo Morales, Ph.D. doctoral candidate in Political Science, Carleton University : Latin America’s neoliberal modernity crisis.
2. André Folloni, Professor at the Pontifical Catholic University of Paraná, State of Paraná, Brazil: The Complexity of the Brazilian Tax Legal System.

PANEL / SESSION 4 : ÉTUDES HISTORIQUES/ESTUDIOS HISTORICOS
1. Natalia Guevara Jaramillo, Estudiante del Doctorado en Estudios Latinoamericanos, Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México (UNAM): Soldados y litigantes : dos ejemplos de movilizacion entre los esclavizados de ascendencia africana durante las guerreas de independencia.
2. Paulo Batista Machado, Étudiant postdoctoral, Université de Montréal et professeur de l'Universidade do Estado da Bahia (UNEB). Historia da educaçao rural no nordeste do Brasil: a contribuiçcao das professoras nao diplomadas ou leigas.

14h-16h
PANEL / SESSION 5 : ACTION  COLLECTIVE ET MOUVEMENTS SOCIAUX/COLLECTIVE ACTION AND SOCIAL MOVEMENTS
1. Tiago Nasser Appel, PhD student in International Political Economy at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro and Emmanuel José Professor of Political Philosophy at the Federal University of Paraná : The June Days of 1848 and the June Days of 2013: the twain shall meet.
2. Joannie Jean, Étudiante au doctorat en sociologie, Université d’Ottawa : Identités et luttes mémorielles chez les familles de « disparus » membres de l'Agrupacion de familiares de detenidos-desaparecidos.
3. Carolyne Ménard, Candidate Maîtrise en bibliothéconomie et sciences de l’information, Université McGill: Le mouvement étudiant chilien de 2011 : conséquence d’une gestion déficiente de l’éducation par les gouvernements de la Concertation pour la démocratie (1990-
2010).

PANEL / SESSION 6: COMMUNICATION INTERNATIONALE, INTERCULTURELLE ET LE DÉVELOPPEMENT : REGARD CROISÉS SUR L’AMÉRIQUE LATINE
1. Carmen Rico de Sotelo, professeure à la Faculté de Communication de l’UQÀM: L’Observatoire de la communication internationale et interculturelle et un survol analytique sur l’Amérique latine.
2. Mylène Drouin, étudiante à la maîtrise en communication à l’UQAM
Département de communication sociale et publique et assistante de recherche pour l’OBSCOMII et le REQCIID : L’OBSCOMII et la présence de l’Amérique Latine dans les travaux des cycles supérieurs : analyse comparative du Brésil et du Chili.
3. Dafne Banegas, diplômée de la maîtrise en communication à l’UQAM
Département de communication sociale et publique et participante au projet UQAMERCOSUD en Uruguay : Cuando el norte es el sur: la representación de Uruguay en las memorias de comunicación e informes de pasantía del proyecto UQAMERCOSUD en Uruguay 2003-2010.
4. Mylène Fauvel, diplômée de la maîtrise en communication à l’UQAM au département de communication sociale et publique : Pouvoirs et stratégies communicationnelles en contexte de travail domestique à Lima.

16h15-18h15
Keynote Speaker - Amphitheatre D0445
John McNeish. Associate Professor Noragric Department of International Environmental and Development Studies Norwegian University of Life Sciences (NMBU).
"Contested Powers: Energy Choices and Energy Struggles in Latin America".

Samedi le 19 avril / Saturday - April 19th
9h-11h
PANEL / SESSION 7: SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT AND HUMAN RIGHTS
President / Discussant : Charmain Levy
1. Álvaro Diego Herrera, Ph.D. Candidate in Communication at the Université de Montréal : Safeguarding the Amazon Witoto: How Indigenous law may challenge the universality of human rights.
2. Daniel Ruiz-Serna, Ph.D. candidate in Anthropology at McGill University: Political violence and landscapes The transformation of forests and agencies in Colombia.
3. Cynthia Lopez, estudiante posdoctoral en ciencias sociales, Université du Québec en Outaouais : Sustentabilidad y viabilidad del ecoturismo como alternativa para la preservación de los recursos naturales y desarrollo de las comunidades rurales e indígenas en Chiapas, México.

PANEL / SESSION 8: REGIONAL INTEGRATION  AND  INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS/INTÉGRATION RÉGIONALE ET LES RELATIONS INTERNATIONALES
President / Discussant: Thomas Collombat
1. Carsten-Andreas Schulz, Doctoral Candidate in International Relations, University of Oxford: Pan-Americanism on Latin American Terms: Non-Hegemonic Agency and International Order in the Western Hemisphere.
2. Nicolas Falomir Lockhart, Candidat au Doctorat en Études internationales, Université Laval : L’influence des projets politiques du Brésil et du Venezuela dans la définition du processus d’intégration en Amérique de Sud.
3. Prof. Dr. Wilson Maske, Professor History Department Pontifical Catholic University of Paraná (PUCPR), Brazil: The Latin American Regional Issues in President Lula’s Foreign Policy (2003-2011).
4. Josée Provençal, Candidate du doctorat en science politique à l’Université d’Ottawa: Intégration régionale et sécurité énergétique : le Brésil dans l’espace sud-américain.

11h15-13h
PANEL / SESSION 9: POLITICS, INSTITUTIONS AND GOVERNANCE/POLITIQUES, INSTITUTIONS ET GOUVERNANCE
President / Discussant: Dimitri della Faille
1. Laura MacDonald, Professor at the Department of Political Science and Institute of Political Economy, Carleton University: "Guns and Butter: Social Policy, Neo-Clientelism, and Efforts to Reduce Violence in Mexico City"
2. Padaic O’Brian, étudiant à la maîtrise en Rural Planning and Development, à l'Université de Guelph : Venezuela : Révolution d’en-haut et insurrection planifiée d’en-bas.
3. Cristina Rojas, Professor at the Department of Political Science, Carleton University: Indigenous World Views in Bolivia –epistemological or ontological differences?

PANEL / SESSION 10: ÉTUDES CULTURELLES/CULTURAL STUDIES
1. Rosario Topete Pérez, PhD candidate at the Department of Modern Languages and Literatures, University of Ottawa: Estudio antropológico, lingüístico y semiótico del cuento oral purhépecha en el contexto cultural mexicano.
2. Gustavo Coelho, Doctorant en Éducation, Université de l'État de Rio de Janeiro (UERJ) : Cultures juvéniles de risque à Rio de Janeiro: essais sur la créativité populaire brésilienne en donner au « Mal » un rôle de résistance.

14h -16h
PANEL / SESSION 11: DROIT À LA VILLE
1. João Carlos Carvalhaes dos Santos Monteiro, Doctorant en études urbaines à l'Université du Québec à Montréal : Les grands projets urbains comme instruments de la néolibéralisation : étude de cas sur le Projet Porto Maravilha à Rio de Janeiro.
2. Eduardo Augusto Wellendorf Sombini, Doctorant en géographie, Universidade Estadual de Campinas (UNICAMP), São Paulo, Brésil: Révalorisation urbaine et activités culturelles : perspectives contemporaines du centre-ville de São Paulo, Brésil.
3. Natalia Alejandra Amor, Arquitecta, cursando Maestría en Ciencias del Territorio FAU UNLP, Argentina: Políticas de vivienda en Argentina y configuración del territorio: potencialidades y conflictos emergentes.

PANEL / SESSION 12: HUMAN RIGHTS AND EMPOWERMENT IN LATIN AMERICA
1. Eduardo Biacchi Gomes, Es Profesor adjunto del marco integral UniBrasil , Licenciatura y Máster en Derecho de la Pontificia Universidad Católica de Paraná.
2. Luis Alexandre Carta Winter, Profesor Programa de Pos-Graduaçao em Direito en la Universidad Católica Pontificia de Paraná: Democracia y Derechos Humanos desde la perspectiva del desarrollo de Sudamérica.
3. Alex Chung : A critical assessment of the rights-based approach (RBA) to development.
4. Joanna L. Kocsis is a Participatory Research Methods Specialist based in Ottawa, Canada: Opening the doors to innovation in Central America: Empowering the most marginalized to address their development challenges through participatory research.

16h15-18h15
Conférencière Principale
Amphitheatre D0445
Marie-France Labrecque. Professeure émérite de l’Université Laval et associée au Département d’anthropologie
"Violence, femmes autochtones d’Amérique latine et droits humains"

Hello Everyone, a fellow paintballer has brought to our attention the urgent need for cold weather clothing for our fellow men, women and children in these very cold winter months. So, O.P.S. has created a "Drop-off" bin at our store located at 2130 Robertson Rd. Unit# 3. What we're looking for is snowsuits, winter jackets, hats, gloves, scarfs, blankets, sleeping bags and anything to help keep you warm. All donations will be brought to the Ottawa Mission on behalf of the Paintball Community. I hope the "BIN of WARMTH" could be filled by the end of every week, so we could drop-off the donation every Saturday. 
 
For more details please contact the store at 613-244-1645 or e-mail at ottawapaintballsupplies@gmail.com 
 
We all thank-you for your support.
1384616575128969.name: O.P.S. Supporting the Ottawa Mission in there Fight Against the Cold

1394776190794214.description:
Two of Canada’s most treasured and celebrated trans artists, Ivan Coyote and Rae Spoon, present their acclaimed multimedia show “Gender Failure,” featuring animation and video elements from Seattle artist Clyde Petersen. Through visuals, words, sounds, and original music, “Gender Failure” explores and exposes the prolific pair’s failed attempts at fitting into the gender binary—and ultimately how the gender binary doesn’t add up. Coyote brings their razor-sharp timing and powerful narrative, while Spoon adds an ethereal voice and poetic turns of phrase to the dynamic duo’s now seven-year-old artistic partnership.

This is also the official Ottawa launch of their book "Gender Failure," a poignant collection of autobiographical essays, lyrics, and images documenting Ivan and Rae's personal journeys from gender failure to gender self-acceptance. Equal parts hilarious and heartbreaking, it's a book that will touch LGBTQ readers and others, revealing, with candor and insight, that gender comes in more than two sizes. Gender Failure is co-written by Rae and Ivan and published by Arsenal Pulp Press:

http://www.arsenalpulp.com/bookinfo.php?index=398

Please join us in welcoming these amazing artists on April 25th at Knox Presbyterian Church, 120 Lisgar Street (at Elgin). This space is wheelchair accessible and has a wheelchair accessible washroom onsite.

Tickets
In Advance: General 20$/Reduced 15$/ Members FREE
At the Door: General 25$/Reduced 20$/Members FREE

For more information about the performers check out:

www.ivanecoyote.com
www.raespoon.com
1394776190794214.name: Ottawa Gender Failure with Ivan E. Coyote and Rae Spoon

Vintage & Antique Dealers....you are wanted for an outstanding day of selling their "Best Stuff"!  The Ottawa Area Chamber of Commerce, Ottawa Main Street Association and @Frankin Franklin County Convention & Visitors Bureau are joining forces with the 10 antique shop dealers in our community for the 5th annual Outdoor Vintage & Antique Flea Market.

Participants will be given the opportunity to locate in Ottawa's downtown and uptown shopping districts.  Those that get their registration in early will be included on a map indicating name and location.  Spaces will be approximately 8'x15'.  The registration fee is $25.00 per space.  Payment is expected at time of registration to receive a space assignment. (Checks made payable to Ottawa Area Chamber of Commerce).

The event will be advertised in the April & May edition of the Discover Vintage America magazine as well as social media, including Facebook, websites & email blasts, banners, flyers, and newspaper ads published in surrounding communities. 

All dealers will be required to sell antique, vintage, and/or primitive merchandise.  New merchandise and crafts will NOT be allowed.  This will be a great opportunity to display and sell your wares.  Get your registration in early!  For questions, call committee chair Sharron Spence at 785-242-6355 or the Ottawa Ottawa Kansas Area Chamber of Commerce at 785-242-1000.

Hello everyone,

Another wonderful year is upon us. This year I have registered again to participate in the Ottawa MS Walk....every step matters whether you choose to participate or donate. Please support my Team '' ESFAM Ninja's'' as we are going to kick some MS butt this spring!!! I am walking 5km and if on that day I feel ''extra great'' I will do 10km!

Here is my personal team page:

http://mssoc.convio.net/site/TR/Walk/OntarioDivision?px=1684661&pg=personal&fr_id=2867&s_locale=en_CA

Thanks again to everyone who has been there for me for all these years! 

Cheers Josée :D

*Here are some info for those who are interested in possibly registering for the walk:
 
When: Sunday, April 27, 2014

Location:  170 Tunney's Pasture, The Jean Talon Building, Ontario

Early Check-in Date: April 21 - 25
Early Check-in Time: 9am - 5pm
Early Check-in Location: Ottawa Chapter, 1826 Woodward Drive

Check-in Time: 8:00am
Start Time: 9:30am 
Route Length(s): Walk: 3km, 5km, 10km Run: 3km, 5km, 10km 

 For more information, contact Ottawa Chapter:
info.ottawa@mssociety.ca | 613-728-1583

Register for the 2014 Ottawa Mandarin MS Walk & Run and start fundraising today! 

In addition to raising awareness, raise pledges to support local programs and services and crucial research into the cause and cure for MS. New this year, we have added a 3km Kids Run for children ages 5 to 15. The 3km, 5km and the 10km routes are fully accessible with rest stations along the way.

Starting at the Jean Talon Building at 170 Tunney’s Pasture Drwy, enjoy a light breakfast before the RCMP Pipe and Drums band officially kicks off the event. At the finish line, you will be offered a festival-like atmosphere with a kids’ bouncy castle, cotton candy and tug-a-war along with entertainment, a BBQ lunch and closing ceremonies.  

Last year, over 1,100 walkers and runners raised more than $300,000. That money helped to fund research into the cure for MS as well as to support vital services for those living with Multiple Sclerosis in the Ottawa area.

3km Kids Run starts: 10:00am

5km and 10km run starts: 10:00am

3, 5 and 10km km walk starts: 10:15am

1408223332783987.description:
Bill C-23, the ironically named “Fair Elections” Act is a bill that will dangerously change how, and if, some Canadians can participate in our democracy. If passed, this act will see US style voter suppression imposed on Canadians and is clearly targeted youth and students, poor people, seniors, Aboriginal people and other marginalized groups. 

The “Fair Elections Act” eliminates key provisions of our current election system – including vouching and voter information cards – which could deprive as many as 520,000 Canadians of their right to vote. The Act will also muzzle Elections Canada, cancelling voter education and engagement programs like Student Vote.

A day of action is planned for Thursday, April 24th, 2014. In Ottawa, a rally is being at the Fairmont Château Laurier at 11am. 

Pierre Poilievre will be "Discussing the Facts" of the Fair Elections at an Economic Club of Canada lunch. We will be present to reveal the truth about this dangerous bill. 

Other events and actions are taking place across the country. Learn more at letpeoplevote.ca or here- https://www.facebook.com/events/502051993249984/?fref=ts

This event is being organized by a coalition of groups including the Canadian Federation of Students, Leadnow, and the Council of Canadians. To add your organization's name, contact s.mccue@cfs-fcee.ca

For more information or to get involved, contact s.mccue@cfs-fcee.ca
1408223332783987.name: Ottawa Rally Against the Unfair Elections Act

1408461776083735.description:
Don't miss the epic DELTA WILL and MORE PLEASE! album release show of 'The Bounty' at Pressed in Ottawa on Saturday June 7th! Music starts at 9pm (you can come earlier for dinner!) - $10 cover.

Pressed serves up delicious food and micro brew pints so come down and make a night of it! 	Pressed is located at 750 Gladstone Ave, Ottawa. (613) 680-9294

MORE PLEASE!

***www.morepleasemusic.ca
***www.facebook.com/pages/MorePlease/186371994788393 

More Please Just named one of top 10 anglo Canadian bands to watch for in 2014

***http://quebec.huffingtonpost.ca/2014/02/10/artistes-anglophones-canadiens-a-surveiller_n_4760385.html

Scotty Mack, the creative inspiration behind the band More Please!, splits his time between guiding trips in the wilderness and playing music in cities. More Please! songs evoke the tension of a polarized Canadian experience, transporting you from gritty city life, through rolling countryside to the woods, and back again.

More Please! has evolved into a shared adventure amongst friends. Chris Norman, Nathan Doucet (Crosss, Mike O’Neil) and Ian MacKay (Basia Bulat) first joined Scotty to create the band. 

After producer and touring artist David Celia recorded a demo of the band in his 1970’s Mississauga bungalow, he joined More Please! and produced a full-length record at his home studio Organica and at Andy Magoffin's House of Miracles. The culmination of this effort is the debut More Please! album The Bounty, to be released in the spring of 2014. The diversity of the rhythms, the inspired arrangements, the balance between psychedelic folk, progressive rock and indie pop will take you on a sonic journey. 

More Please! has found inspiration by collaborating live and in the studio with a wide range of musicians: Warren Spicer and Mathew Woodley (Plants and Animals), Joe Grass (Patrick Watson), Josh Toal (Katie Moore), Dani Oore (Gypsophelia), Bob Wiseman (Blue Rodeo), Leanne Zacharias (Christine Fellows, Hylozoists), Sarah Page (Barr Brothers), Bryden Baird (Fiest), Rebekah Higgs, Jeff Louch and Terra Lightfoot among others.

The More Please! adventure does not end with the album; witnessing a live performance will let you experience their musical landscape first-hand 

DELTA WILL

***www.deltawill.com
***www.facebook.com/deltawillmusic

Delta Will is an interstellar visitor - an alien that has fallen in love with humanity and its traditions of folk, blues and pop music. Using Charles Tilden’s body as its vessel, Delta Will has been translating its earthly experiences into its own artful pop songs. Combining infectious layers of soaring vocals, spacey guitar riffs and pulsating beats, Delta Will’s music has been described as a crafty, charming spell that rouses between modern blues and romantic art rock.

The songs contemplate what it means to be human and what to make of an uncertain and potentially apocalyptic future. Each Delta Will performance is an intimate and unpredictable experience, with live mash-ups of influential songs thrown in to the set of original material.
1408461776083735.name: DELTA WILL + MORE PLEASE! Album Launch // Pressed, Ottawa

1409964709264921.description:
The acclaimed documentary, Through the Fire, will screen at the Centre for Social Innovation in Toronto on Monday April 14th. Hosted by the Dr. Hawa Abdi Foundation and Human Concern International, the screening will be followed by a Q&A session with Dr. Deqo Mohamed, CEO of the Dr. Hawa Abdi Foundation and daughter of Dr. Hawa Abdi. 

After over two decades of war, Somalia has been portrayed internationally as a lawless state marred by piracy, conflict, and famine. However, Through the Fire presents a different side of Somalia, telling the stories of three courageous Somali women who never gave up on their country. The three women, Dr. Hawa Abdi, Dr. Edna Adan, and Ilwad Elman, are icons of strength and resiliency. 

Funds raised from the screening will go directly towards supporting the Pediatric Department at the Dr. Hawa Abdi General Hospital in Somalia. Additional donations are welcomed at the event. 

Admission: Adult $15; Students $10

Mayfair Theatre
1074 Bank Street, Ottawa, ON
(613) 730-3403

Or 

HCI Office: 613-742-5948
Washim: 613-866-3836

Click on the link below for early reservation: 
https://humanconcern.org/through-the-fire-ottawa

1413979435512204.description:
(Le français suit.) OAG presents two solo exhibitions that allow us to reflect on the complex nature of memorials. In the Firestone Gallery is an exhibition of mid-twentieth century abstract painting from the Painters Eleven.

OPENING RECEPTION & ARTISTS IN CONVERSATION: 
Thursday, Feb. 6, at 5:30 pm
Join us in welcoming artists David R. Harper and Rémi Thériault, who will  discuss their works with Ola Wlusek, Curator of Contemporary Art. 

 **SOLD-OUT EVENT** OFFICIAL AFTER-PARTY with DESTROYER
ST. ALBAN’S CHURCH, 454 KING EDWARD AVE
Arboretum Arts Festival, Herd Magazine and OAG present DESTROYER (Dan Bejar), known as one of Canada’s most idiosyncratic and razor-sharp songwriters, in an intimate church venue. https://www.facebook.com/events/564229393665480/?fref=ts

DAVID R. HARPER: ENTRE LE CHIEN ET LE LOUP
Feb. 7 to June 6, 2014
Guest Curator: Ann MacDonald, Doris McCarthy Gallery
A multi-layered expression, “entre chien et loup” is used to describe a specific time of day, just before night, when the light is so dim one cannot distinguish a dog from a wolf. David R. Harper’s remarkably varied practice exemplifies carefully considered ventures into the history of humankind, and histories of making objects for contemplation.
Organized by the Doris McCarthy Gallery in partnership with the Kitchener-Waterloo Art Gallery, Kenderdine Art Gallery, and Saint Mary’s University Art Gallery.

RÉMI THÉRIAULT: FRONT
Feb. 7 to June 6, 2014
Curator: Ola Wlusek
Front reflects on the role nature plays in helping individuals heal and remember. The exhibition consists of a series of large-scale colour photographs by the Ottawa-based artist, focusing on the physical transformation of European sites where Canadian armies fought in the First World War. Literary works by Andrew Vincent and Colin Vincent accompany the exhibition.

BRINGING IT HOME: ABSTRACTION AND THE PAINTERS ELEVEN
Jan. 11 to March 23, 2014
Guest Curator: David Kaarsemaker
The Painters Eleven, based in Toronto, were united in a desire to bring to Canada the exciting artistic developments occurring on the international stage. By the time they disbanded in 1960, they had helped cement the reputation of abstract painting in Canada.

***
Le Nouvel An débute à la GAO avec deux expositions individuelles et complémentaires qui permettent d'engager une réflexion sur la complexité afférente à la création de lieux et de monuments. D'ailleurs, dans la Galerie Firestone, il y a une exposition de peinture abstraite, du milieu du XXe siècle, consacrée au groupe Painters Eleven.

VERNISSAGE ET ARTISTES EN DIALOGUE
Le jeudi 6 février à 17 h 30
Aidez-nous à accueillir les artistes David R. Harper et Rémi Thériault qui discuteront de leurs pratiques avec la commissaire d'art contemporain Ola Wlusek. Ensuite, c'est le vernissage de 18 h à 21 h.

L'APRÈS-FÊTE OFFICIELLE avec DESTROYER
À L'ÉGLISE ST. ALBANS, 454 AV. KING-EDWARD, OTTAWA
Arboretum Arts Festival, le magazine Herd et la GAO présente DESTROYER (Dan Bejar), un des auteurs-compositeurs les plus particuliers et vifs au Canada, dans le milieu intime d'une église. Pour de plus amples renseignements : https://www.facebook.com/events/564229393665480/?fref=ts

DAVID R. HARPER. ENTRE LE CHIEN ET LE LOUP
Du 7 fév. au 6 juin 2014
Commissaire invitée : Ann MacDonald de la Doris McCarthy Gallery
L'expression « entre chien et loup » est souvent expliqué comme désignant le moment où l'on ne distinguerait pas un chien d'un loup, surtout la période située à la tombée de la nuit. La démarche remarquablement variée de David R. Harper porte un regard attentif sur l'aventure humaine et l'histoire de la fabrication d'objets de contemplation.
L’exposition est organisée par la Doris McCarthy Gallery en partenariat avec la Kitchener-Waterloo Art Gallery, la Kenderdine Art Gallery et Saint Mary’s University Art Gallery.

RÉMI THÉRIAULT. FRONT
Du 7 fév. au 6 juin 2014
Commissaire : Ola Wlusek
Front se penche sur le rôle que la nature joue dans l'acte de guérison et de souvenir. L'exposition présente une série de photographies en couleurs de grand format prises par l'artiste basé à Ottawa, qui se concentre sur la transformation physique des sites européens où les armées canadiennes ont combattu.

FAIRE SA DEMEURE. LA PEINTURE ABSTRAITE DU GROUPE DES ONZE
Du 11 janvier au 23 mars 2014
Commissaire invité : David Kaarsemaker
L'intention du Groupe des Onze de Toronto consistait à faire découvrir au public canadien les stimulants développements artistiques qui avaient alors cours sur la scène internationale. Au moment où le groupe se sépare, en 1960, la peinture abstraite était bien implantée au Canada.
1413979435512204.location: The Ottawa Art Gallery |  La Galerie d'art d'Ottawa
1413979435512204.name: David R. Harper, Rémi Thériault and/et Painters Eleven at the OAG/à la GAO

1415063178745281.description:
Friends and Family in the Ottawa/Gatineau Region..... Come out and wear YELLOW and support all those living with Osteoegensis Imperfecta on May 4th, 2014! 

Osteogenesis Imperfecta (OI - or more commonly known as brittle bone disease) is characterized by fragile bones which break very easily. OI affects over 25,000 people in Canada alone, yet many people are unfamiliar with this rare, often misunderstood genetic condition.   As a community, we have over 50 families affected with OI in the Ottawa/Gatineau region and on May 4th, we celebrate those amazing people and show the world how OI is no showstopper!  

To raise awareness for OI, we will be hosting a Stroll and Roll event in Ottawa, Ontario! Come out and wear yellow and support all those touched by Osteogenesis Imperfecta! 

Our walk will take place on Sunday May 4th at The FarmTeam Cookhouse & Bar  at 10am.  

***Please arrive early to check in***

We will walk down Bank street up to Landsdown Park and back followed by a BBQ buffet hosted by Farmteam! 

In order to secure the location and to cover the cost of food, we ask that everyone register BEFORE April 25th.
Price includes venue, food and activities for the kids! 

Registration (payable morning of event):
$10/ adult  $5/child 

OI CAN AND I WILL!

To register or for more info please contact: 
Amanda Hansen 
(819) 329  - 1829 
  or 
amanda.emily.hansen@gmail.com

JazzWorks Sunday Jam at the Carleton Tavern
Sunday, May 4, 2014 - 2 to 5 p.m.
Cover: $5. Free admission for students!
Host Band: The Kavchak/Kubelka/Menard Trio
•	Michael Kavchak - bass
•	Anthony Kubelka - piano
•	Daniel Menard - drums
These students all are members of the Ottawa Junior Jazz Band, and of the Bells Corners Academy Jazz Camp Band where they work with Yves Laroche.
JazzWorks has started a second monthly jam series. Besides the current evening jam on the third Thursday of each month, it also runs an afternoon jam on the first Sunday of the month.
Charley Gordon writes: "One of the hopes is that this afternoon jam session will be attractive to students who, for some reason, generally avoid taverns on weekday nights. Depending on attendance and other factors, we might do some experimenting with format in this new jam."
Whether you're a jazz lover, or jazz instrumentalist or vocalist at any level, you are most welcome to join the fun with the improvised blend of the familiar and unexpected.  Musicians of intermediate level and up are encouraged to participate in the jam.  If you will be calling a tune, you must bring at least three copies of lead sheets in your concert C key for other musicians, and charts for Bb and Eb instruments would be appreciated by horn players.

The Carleton Tavern
223 Armstrong Street (at Parkdale, one block north of Wellington St. West, and immediately north of the Parkdale Market)
Ottawa

1417168301886384.description:
Tom Cho and Greg Bechtel will launch their edgy, sexy new books at Venus Envy on May 15.
 
May 15
7:30 pm (doors at 7)
Venus Envy
226 Bank Street, Ottawa
free

===

ABOUT THE BOOKS AND AUTHORS
 
LOOK WHO'S MORPHING by Tom Cho

First published to acclaim in Australia, Look Who's Morphing by Asian-Australian writer Tom Cho is a funny, fantastical, often outlandish collection of stories firmly grounded in pop culture. The book's central character undergoes a series of startling transformations, shape-shifting through figures drawn from film, television, music, books, porn flicks, and comics. Often accompanied by family members, this narrator becomes Godzilla, Suzi Quatro, Whitney Houston's bodyguard, a Muppet, a gay leatherman, a nun who becomes a governess to the von Trapp children, and, in the book's lavish climax, a 100-foot-tall guitar-wielding rock star performing for an adoring troupe of fans in Tokyo.

Influenced by the teen book series Sweet Valley High, Tom Cho began writing creative works in his mid-teens. He has a PhD in Professional Writing from Deakin University and, alongside his work as a fiction writer, he has a parallel career as a freelance writer and editor. Like his favorite pop stars, Tom enjoys trying new guises on for size, and his work has been described as being "transgenre, transgender, and transcultural all at once." Born and raised in Australia, Tom is a newcomer to North America.
 
BOUNDARY PROBLEMS by Greg Bechtel
 
“Boundary Problems is a chaotic collection with comic touches, a paranoid Pynchonesque mix-tape of hosers and hipster cafes, office jobs and summer camp confessions, lit theory and online porn. Boundary problems? No problem for Greg Bechtel; his debut is wild, sly, and magnetic.” – Mark Anthony Jarman, author of 19 Knives
 
Originally from Kitchener-Waterloo, Ontario, Greg Bechtel has lived at various times in Toronto, Deep River, Jamaica, Ottawa, Quebec City, and Fredericton while working (among other things) as a lifeguard, technical writer, mover, visual basic programmer, camp counsellor, semiconductor laser labtech, cab driver, tutor, and teacher. Currently, he lives and writes in Edmonton, where he teaches English Literature and Creative Writing at the University of Alberta whenever they let him. Boundary Problems is his first book.
1417168301886384.name: Greg Bechtel and Tom Cho in Ottawa

1428486690735932.description:
The Morgentaler clinic is closing in New Brunswick. This is bad news for the people of New Brunswick and of PEI - right now, their choice is to get the permission of 2 doctors, or pay $800. Starting in July, they will only be able to access an abortion with the permission of 2 doctors. This is a violation of the Canada Health Act, is terrible health policy, and endangers the lives of women.

There are solidarity rallies happening across the country - We are organizing one in Ottawa : SATURDAY, April 26 at 2pm.

Please spread the word !

Also : people in Fredericton are A) bringing wire coat hangers to place on the steps of their legislature. Let's do the same. Please bring wire coat hangers if you have them. and B) wearing red. If you can too, awesome. 


-------------

Rassemblement en solidarité avec Pro Choix Nouveau-Brunswick à Ottawa! 

La clinique Morgentaler fermera ses portes en juillet au Nouveau-Brunswick. Il s'agit d'une mauvaise nouvelles pour les gens de cette province et de l'ÎPÉ. En effet, la loi 84-20 demande la signature de deux médecins, l'avortement doit être effectué par un spécialiste (seulement deux hôpitaux offrent le service), ET la personne doit avoir une raison "médicale" qui la pousse à avoir un avortement. Ceci contrevient La loi canadienne sur la santé, c'est une politique immonde et ça met en danger la vie des gens. La clinique offre donc un service fondamental qui se doit d'être financé par le gouvernement.

Des rassemblements en solidarité se déroulent partout au pays, et nous en organisons un à Ottawa le SAMEDI, 26 avril à 14h00.

Faites passer le mot!

Aussi: les gens de Fredericton apportent des cintres en métal à leur rassemblement pour les déposer sur les escaliers de l'Assemblée législative. Prenons leur exemple. Apportez des cintres en métal si vous en avez! Elles et ils vont également s'habiller en rouge. Si on peut faire de même : génial.
1428486690735932.name: Ottawa Solidarity Rally : New Brunswick Pro Choice / Rassemblement en solidarité avec Pro Choix Nouveau-Brunswick à Ottawa

1430572280525048.description: Come experience the body’s yin/yang relationship to yoga practice, the physics of flight, the science of effortless balance. Sun Salutations and breathing exercises (kriyas and pranayama) will form the basis for re-examining popular ideas about “core” and practising in a way that develops a floaty practice of handstands and arm balances. Close attention will be given to the transitions between postures common to Vinyasa Flow classes, and how certain key details open the door to developing floaty practice of arm balances and inversions. In addition, we'll do partner work building up to forearm stand, headstand, handstand and crow variations.
1430572280525048.name: Arm Balances, Inversions & Hips Workshop

1437752083136641.description:
An illustrated talk by Hiraku Yoshitake
Natural Resources Inventory Center, National Institute for
Agro-Environmental Sciences, Tsukuba, Japan

Japan, which was originally attached to the eastern coast of the  Eurasian continent, includes three zoogeographic regions: Palearctic, Oriental and Oceanic. Japan's most recent census lists more than 10,000  Coleoptera species for Japan. This presentation will be a general introduction of the beetle fauna of Japan for Canadian colleagues, showing the lives of Japanese beetles (weevils, in particular) taken by Hiraku and Naoko Yoshitake, and their friends.

All persons interested in insects are invited to attend.
More info: Hume Douglas 613-759-7128, or Vasily Grebennikov
613-759-7519
1437752083136641.name: Ottawa Entomology Club - A World of Japanese Beetles

1441886659386655.description:
On May 10, people across Canada are rallying to Defend our Climate and Communities from pipelines, dirty energy projects and runaway climate change - www.defendourclimate.ca

Join us for an Ottawa gathering at Rideau Falls Park - where the Rideau meets the Ottawa river.

We’ll have a mock-up of the Energy East pipeline that we’ll work together to dismantle! There will also be some music and a few short statements.

If you can, please bring a visual symbol of the bright future you want to see – a drop of water, a tree, a polar bear – please see this guide for creating amazing visuals: https://s3.amazonaws.com/s3.defendourclimate.ca/May+12/DoC-Visuals+Kit.pdf

The Rideau Falls lies 40km downstream from where the Energy East pipeline would cross the Rideau River. This area could be potentially devastated by a pipeline spill.

With the recently proposed Energy East pipeline joining other proposed pipelines across the country, our local watersheds and land are under direct threat. If these pipelines were built, they would make it impossible for Canada to do its fair share to stop climate change.

We have a real opportunity to change that. As millions of people in the United States stand together against the Keystone XL pipeline, it’s our job here to stand for a  better energy future.

Globally, there is now more investment in renewable energy than all fossil fuels combined. Canada could be making a needed transition to renewable energy that would help ensure a safe climate for future generations.

We  need to make a stand for this to happen. We cannot allow for reckless tar sands expansion, or the construction of pipelines like Energy East that would facilitate that expansion.

Join us – and 60 other communities – who are uniting their voices on May 10th, to say no to tar sands expansion, no to the proposed energy east pipeline, and yes to a safe climate future and renewable energy.
1441886659386655.name: Ottawa: Defend Our Climate!

1443951262512884.description:
With Special Guests SHOCK.
Tickets available online NOW at: www.thebrassmonkey.bigcartel.com OR in person at The Brass Monkey. Catch Canada’s most successful metal band ever (working on studio record #15) & on its way to 3 million records sold world-wide) before they head off to Europe on their summer festival tour! ANNIHILATOR is coming off a hugely successful 2013: Their 14th studio album “Feast” received rave reviews and charted all over Europe. The band also played some of the Continent’s biggest festivals, including the legendary Wacken Festival, where they opened Day 1 with Deep Purple and Rammstein in front of 80,000 people. Check out a song from the show here http://youtu.be/1HvmLe5lqBA

ANNIHILATOR has toured the planet as headliners and co-headliners for 25 years, as well as infamous tours with Judas Priest, Pantera and shows with Rammstein, Megadeth, Iron Maiden, Alice In Chains and many others. Jeff Waters is widely regarded by fans and critics alike as one of metal’s best and most influential guitarists and the band has a well-earned reputation for delivering intense and super tight live performances. 

ANNIHILATOR will be playing all their blistering hits, as well as some new additions, in preparation for their big tour. 

Ottawa veteran rockers SHOCK will be opening the show! Debuting in 1985, SHOCK received rave reviews for a series of demo recordings which were circulated among the worldwide Metal underground. SHOCK's live performances throughout Eastern Canada, as a headliner and opener for Metal titans such as MEGADETH, MOTÖRHEAD, ANTHRAX, METAL CHURCH, SWORD and many more, established the band's reputation as one of Canada's most original offerings to the period Metal scene. 

Don't miss this special exclusive tour kick-off show at The Brass Monkey, 250 Greenbank Rd. in Ottawa on Monday June 2, 2014. 

Buy your tickets at The Brass Monkey or online at thebrassmonkey.bigcartel.com.
1443951262512884.name: ANNIHILATOR ROCKS OTTAWA!

Artist Bios, Links, and Sounds:


BAZZA RANKS (Dirty Dubsters) [IRELAND] ~ Irish Moss Recordings

The Dirty Dubsters are made up of Dublin based production/DJ duo BAZZA RANKS and JAY SHARP. They have been established under this moniker since mid 2009, however the duo has been collaborating together on various productions and as part of the Break-Down crew since early 2006.

Their sound is everything from nu funk, party breaks, bootlegs, breakbeat, drum n bass, hip-hop and house. There is a definite theme running through all their tracks, with the majority strongly glued down by reggae samples combined with big drum beats and fat driving bass grooves.

1448291732073765.description:
From April 7-28, the Council of Canadians, with local partners, will be visiting communities across Ontario to talk about why TransCanada’s proposed Energy East pipeline is all risk and little reward for Ontarians.

The tour will be in Ottawa on Sunday, April 13. 

Join: 

- Maude Barlow, Council of Canadians Chairperson
- Eriel Deranger of the Athabasca Chipewyan First Nation 
- Graham Saul of Ecology Ottawa 

Hear about local impacts, safety and spill concerns and what this means for tar sands expansion, protecting our climate and water. Find out how you can get involved in the movement to stop Energy East.

FREE ADMISSION! FIRST COME FIRST SERVE!

DOORS OPEN AT 6:30, event 7:00-8:30pm  

Background information: 

TransCanada’s Energy East pipeline project would convert a 40 year-old natural gas pipeline from Saskatchewan to Ontario, connecting it with new pipeline through Quebec and on to Saint John, New Brunswick. Transporting 1.1 million barrels of oil every day, it would be the largest oil pipeline in North America.

This tour is taking place at the same time as Ontario Energy Board consultations on the pipeline. These consultations are an important platform to have our voices heard, and encourage our provincial government to stand up for Ontarians against this broken pipeline plan.

For background information and to read more, please visit http://canadians.org/energyeast-tour
1448291732073765.name: OTTAWA EVENT: Energy East, Our Risk - Their Reward, Ontario tour

1454977198064665.description:
Statement from Sacha Deptuck:

"Like many of you know; I recently had the biggest fight of my life when I was diagnosed with L'Hermitte-Duclose disease, which is basically a benign tumor of the cerebellum. I'm not out of the woods yet, but everyday will be a positive, up hill battle.  

I was in the hospital for 11 days and received the best care I could have wished for at the Ottawa Civic Hospital. The staff was professional, kind and possessed expertise like no other! 

During my time there,  I was in the Acute Neurological Intensive Care unit and was lucky enough to be given one of the "Cadillac" beds. Those beds are very limited in the ward and not every patient gets to have one...but they do help provide the appropriate care needed for people in need recovering from cancers, strokes, and more.

I want to pay the Ottawa Civic Hospital back for the terrific care I've received.

When they gave my bed to someone that was more in need (and assigned me to a normal bed), I realized that every patient that was placed into that ward shouldn't be sleeping on the normal beds that are extremely uncomfortable but one of those "Cadillac" beds.

I hope that the proceeds raised can go towards the purchase of another "Cadillac" bed for the ward."


Event will be comprised of:

Silent auction
Starts:: March 30 9 A.M 
Closes: April 6th noon

Handle with Care wrestling exhibition brought to you by the stars Mecca Pro Wrestling.


Live Entertainment  featuring some of Eastern Ontario's top talent such as RMJ and The FreakBoy, Right on Band from Ottawa.

Face painting and family fun games 

50/50 draw.

The event will have a BBQ and baked goods will also be sold.

100% of the profits goes to the Ottawa Hospital Neurology Department!

Thanks everyone! More details and more events to be added!
1454977198064665.name: "Handle With Care" -  Fundraiser for the Ottawa Hospital Neurology Department - FAMILY FUN DAY!

1458775084358218.description: Join us to explore our nations beautiful capital to celebrate the 62nd Annual Tulip Festival.  This is "a celebration founded on friendship" and is the worlds largest tulip festival.  The festival began in 1945 when the Dutch royal family gifted 100 000 tulip bulbs in appreciation of Canada providing a safe haven for the dutch family, the birth of the dutch princess, and the role of Canadian troops during WWII in freeing the Netherlands.  For more details on events and history see http://tulipfestival.ca/.  Tickets cover transportation to and from Ottawa, the festival is open attendance.

1468683626678003.description:
I'm sure all of you are aware by this point that I play and coach quidditch. My team, GeeGees Quidditch, won Canadian Cup this year and will be going to the World Cup in South Carolina to represent our school and Canada - we are one of only 4 Canadian teams going. One of those other 4 teams is our sister team, Maple Rush Quidditch. They also represent uOttawa, and we're all super excited for the chance to have 2 of the top 4 Canadian teams representing our school.

In order to get to World Cup though, we're doing a lot of fundraising. We have 42 international-level athletes plus 2 coaches all trying to get there, and as students we don't have a whole lot of our own money! We're all going to be paying for our own flights and are hoping to fundraise enough to cover hotels and transportation on the ground in Myrtle Beach. 

This group of people is my family here in Ottawa. We have Thanksgiving and Easter dinners, study parties during exams, and help each other out with life when we need it. I would personally really appreciate it if you can donate anything - even $1 or $2 would help! Every athlete we're taking puts in hours of work every week and we're hoping that this year we can be the first non-US team to make the Sweet 16 (last year we were the first non-US team to make bracket play, so this year we want to make it further!). 

We have some pretty fantastic thank-you gifts if you donate. There's everything from a twitter shout-out to a postcard from Myrtle Beach to a custom tote-bag, hand-made by yours truly! Every little bit helps. Even if you can't donate, I'd really appreciate if you could pass this link on to your friends and anyone you know of who might support a group of Canadian quidditch players! 

Indiegogo link can be found here: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/uottawa-quidditch-goes-to-world-cup

Thank you in advance for any donations or passing-on of the link! If you donate, let me know, because I want to be able to send you a thank-you note :)
1468683626678003.name: Help uOttawa Quidditch get to World Cup!

1471819653033556.description:
Fuck the Facts + Ritual Dictates @ Electric Owl 
Saturday April 26th, 2014 
Doors 7:00 PM
Curfew: 10:30 PM
$10 ADV 
http://ticketf.ly/1gfvUkH


FUCK THE FACTS ( Ottawa, ON )
Capital city bastardized grind stalwarts.
https://fuckthefacts.bandcamp.com
https://facebook.com/fuckthefacts

Started as a band in a basement in Ottawa, Canada, during the winter of 2001, it was only about a month before Fuck The Facts did their first recording and not much longer after that the band would hit the stage for the first time.

More than 10 years later; Fuck the Facts has maintained the same sense of urgency with constant releases and a hefty touring schedule that has taken them numerous times across North America and Europe. 

In 2006 Fuck The Facts signed a multi-album deal with one of the underground metal scenes’ biggest labels: Relapse Records. The same year the band released the album “Stigmata High-Five” and toured extensively, only to take a break from the road to record their sophomore release “Disgorge Mexico” in 2008.

Following the release of “Disgorge Mexico”, Fuck The Facts took a step back to the band’s more DIY roots with a number of independent releases.  A 3rd full length for Relapse Records, “Die Miserable”, was released in 2011 and nominated for a Juno in the Best Metal/Hard Rock Album category.  

Now with the acclaimed newest release “Amer”, which was produced entirely at the band’s own studio (Apartment 2) and self-released, Fuck The Facts continues to grow not only musically, but also with DIY independence, showing that there really is no end in sight. 


RITUAL DICTATES ( Vancouver, BC )
https://facebook.com/ritualdictates

Inspired by a wide array of styles and instruments, the music itself has straightforward elements of metal and grind, with detours into anything from half time black metal to good time rock and roll.

Picking up on inspiration from their respective previous bands Allfather and Angel Grinder, Justin and Ash are continuing down the heavy metal path while fusing their eclectic influences of classic rock and roll, punk, black metal and grind into interesting new places.

-------------------------------------------------

For Party/Guestlist service inquiries please contact:
guestlist@electricowl.ca

Like our Page! => https://www.facebook.com/ElectricOwlSocialClub

Interested in joining our Street Team? Hit us up at info@electricowl.ca!
1471819653033556.name: TONIGHT! Fuck The Facts (Ottawa) + Ritual Dictates @ Electric Owl

1471842159717445.description:
In recognition of World Fair Trade Day on May 10, we are inviting you for an Ottawa screening of the internationally acclaimed film "Black Gold". This film follows an Ethiopian coffee producer's epic journey around the world as he works hard to get a fair price for the high quality coffee for some 74,000 coffee farmers, who are part of the Oromia Coffee Farmers Co-operative Union. A truly moving and eye-opening film that changed the way I consume coffee. 

Fair trade coffee, tea and goodies will be served, and we hope you will join us for a meaningful discussion on what fair trade means to you and what we as individuals can do to help make a difference. 

What: Ottawa screening of "Black Gold". Watch the trailer here:  www.blackgoldmovie.com

When: May 10, 2014, at 1:45 p.m., with the movie starting at 2 p.m.

Where: Coop Voisins' "Common Room" at 440 Wiggins Private, Ottawa. 

Why: To raise awareness and engage in discussion on fair trade as a global issues.

1484663055095875.description:
In late April 2012, the federal government announced a series of sweeping changes to the Interim Federal Health (IFH) program (http://www.cic.gc.ca/english/refugees/outside/arriving-healthcare.asp), the health insurance program for refugees in Canada. The changes came into effect on June 30, 2012. On June 29th the federal government announced after significant public pressure that government assisted refugees would not be impacted by these cuts.

The previous IFH program provided access to medical care, diagnostic services and laboratory testing very similar to what is provided by provincial health plans. It also provided access to medications, emergency dental care and vision care similar to what is available to people on provincial social assistance plans.

Health care workers across the country have organized to oppose these cuts and advocate for their reversal. Many feel that resettled refugees are suffering or will suffer tremendous hardship by not being able to access medications. They are at risk of severe complications. Health care workers are also deeply concerned that people from DCO’s are unable to access care for even life threatening conditions. Many have also suggested that the cuts will only result in increased costs.

Organizations opposing cuts to refugee health care:
i. College of Family Physicians of Canada
ii. Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada
iii. Canadian Association of Optometrists
iv. Canadian Association of Social Workers
v. Canadian Dental Association
vi. Canadian Medical Association
vii. Canadian Nurses Association
viii. Canadian Pharmacists Association
ix. Canadian Association of Community Health Centres
x. Canadian Doctors for Medicare
xi. Canadian Association of Midwives
xii. Registered Nurses Association of Ontario
xiii. Canadian Federation of Nurses Union
xiv. Canadian Psychiatric Association
xv. Canadian Paediatric Society
xvi. Association of Medical Microbiology and Infectious Diseases Canada
xvii. Médecins du Monde
xviii. Public Physicians of Canada
xix. Ontario’s Council of Medical Officers of Health
xx. Canadian Association of Occupational Therapists
xxi. Canadian Association of Emergency Physicians
1484663055095875.name: Refugee Day of Action 2014: Ottawa chapter

1487589568120026.description:
Our Ask Women Anything event is scheduled for Thursday April 24th at 5:30 p.m. at The Hintonburg Public House (1020 Wellington Street West)!

We are featuring Kathie Donovan, an author, broadcaster, public speaker who is well known in the Ottawa community and beyond. In the span of 35 years behind the microphone, both on radio and in front of the camera on television, Kathie has shared inspiring stories about people who have made a difference by bringing their dreams to life. Whether it’s Celine Dion, a young Ryan Gosling, dedicated craftspeople and artists or the everyday heroes who work the land, the stories Kathie is known for are all ultimately about the beauty and strength of the human spirit.  In the latest chapter of her career, Kathie is using her gifts and combining two of her favourite subjects: human behaviour and spirituality. on April 24th, Kathie wants to share them with you!

This is your opportunity to speak to a media personality  directly and ask those questions that you have always wanted to ask!  Come and ask Kathie Donovan any question you have, and have great food and drinks. And we have fabulous raffle prizes that you can buy tickets for just before and during this AWA: $2 for one ticket, $5 for three tickets.

See you on the 24th!
1487589568120026.name: The Ask Women Anything Series: Ottawa author/broadcaster Kathie Donovan

Thirsty for change? 

Right now exciting things are happening and big decisions are being made so it's crucial that we stick together to help push for a positive change!

There are too many things wrong with our leaders' way of thinking, so it's our duty to express how we feel!

As you might know, 420 is the largest peaceful celebration in Canada. Last year, over 10,000 people showed up on Parliament Hill. It was beautiful. Here's a little video clip from last year:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YwQw38mwRUM

For this year's event, great minds and artists will be coming together with a common message. But it'll only work fully if you're there singing with us.

Hosted by the beautiful Precious Chong (yes...the daughter of Tommy Chong from Cheech and Chong) and sponsored by Bob Erb, 420 will feature a number of exciting performances. Here are some of the artists that will be performing on Parliament Hill, from 12 p.m. to 5 p.m.

Dynamite Motel

1548866908670793.description:
This May 4th, join the Ottawa Skeptics for our fourth open conference event, Skepticamp Ottawa 2014.

Skepticamps, modeled on the BarCamp approach of non-curated, user-driven content and participation, are entertaining, educational and informative events in a relaxed environment. The overall theme is science, skepticism and critical thinking. 

This year we are once again at the Shopify Lounge, right in the heart of downtown Ottawa. Come along to listen to some great talks, ask questions, and meet interesting people!

We have a full day of fascinating talks from 16 speakers, including three excellent keynotes: Katie Gibbs, co-founder of Evidence for Democracy; Michael Kruse, Chair of Bad Science Watch; and Jim Davies, Director of the Science of the Imagination Laboratory at Carleton University.

Talk synopses and speaker bios are available at Ottawaskeptics.org, and the full schedule is also listed here.

Everyone’s welcome!

To give us an idea of attendance please RSVP at meetup or here and check out the logistics page for more information (http://www.ottawaskeptics.org/2014/04/05/skepticamp-ottawa-2014-logistics/). 

If you can’t make the full day, feel free to just drop in for the talks you want to see. We look forward to seeing you there! 

1000	1005	Marlowe: Welcome to Skepticamp	
1005	1040	Jim Davies:	The Beauty of Bad Ideas	
1040	1100	Alex Demarsh:	Near/Far: An introduction to construal level theory	
1100	1120	Kyla Cullain: Vaccine Preventable Diseases: a need for a shift in strategy
1120	1130	Break		
1135	1155	Kirsten Brouse:	Why co-ops make good capitalism	
1155	1230	Katie Gibbs:	No Science, No Evidence, No Truth, No Democracy	
1230	1330	Lunch break	
1330	1350	M Farkas-Dyck:	Food and Alternatives	
1350	1410	Krista Thomas:	5 Myths about GMOs	
1410	1430	Clifford Beninger:	Why the 12-step Disease Concept of Addiction Must be Abandoned	
1430	1505	Michael Kruse:	Science Advocacy on the Fringe	
1505	1520	Break	
1520	1540	Nicholas Robinson:	Do you understand F=ma?	
1540	1600	Danielle Quigley:	Why is scientific inquiry important to bullying prevention and intervention programs?	
1600	1620	Darren McKee:	Myths of Foreign Aid
1620	1630	Break
1630	1650	Josh Bowie:	Free Will	
1650	1710	Able Varghese:	Engineering and Tech. Entreprenurship
1710	1730	Julian Janes:	Cold reading: train to be a charlatan in 15 minutes or less

http://www.ottawaskeptics.org/2014/04/05/skepticamp-ottawa-2014-schedule/
1548866908670793.name: Skepticamp Ottawa 2014

181742158693171.description:
Order tickets via Eventbrite:
http://ottawabadassdash.eventbrite.com/?aff=efbevent

30 BADASS obstacles sprawled across a 7K course, the ultimate adventure race and obstacle course challenge. BADASS Dash benefits Autism Speaks, working together with the goal of overcoming obstacles for Autism. 

BADASS Dash has 4 divisions for you to choose from, including our brand new K-9 Companion Division: 


RECREATION DIVISION – Run, Jog, Walk or Crawl – It’s your personal challenge! Conquer 25+ obstacles sprawled across a 7K course! To participate in the Recreation Division you must be 14+ years of age.
ELITE TRAINED DIVISION - This division is for the avid athlete, first responders, military, and the ultra competitive. If you're focused on the competition and your race time this is the division for you! There's no skipping obstacles in this division; increased difficulty with additional obstacles, terrain and / or distance or modified obstacles to really make you stand out! To Participate in the Elite Division you must be 18+ years of age.
K-9 COMPANION DIVISION - The first of it's kind! Bring your dog to take part in the 5-9 K-9 obstacles specifically designed / modified for you and your dog! So, the time is now -- bring Fido out for a real challenge!
KIDS DASH - Take part in the Kids Dash with divisions for 4-6 and 7-13 year olds with obstacles designed just their size. Make it a family affair and bring your kids out to a fun and exciting challenge.

FAQs

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?


IDs are required for picking up racer packet, signing waivers, and consuming any alcoholic beverages during the post race festival. 
Kids Aged 4-13 can take part in the Kids Dash
14+ aged racers can compete in the Recreation Division & K-9 Division
18+ aged racers can compete in the Elite Trained Division 
K-9 Companion participants must be 1 year of age or older

Where can I find the most up-to-date details about the Ottawa BADASS Dash? 

http://www.badassdash.com/2014-ottawa.html

Where can I print off my waiver?

If you'd like to print off your waiver form to save time at packet pick-up you can do so online at http://www.badassdash.com/tl_files/badassdash/docs/2013/general/13-General-BADASS-Dash-Waiver.pdf 

Where / When is Packet Pick-Up?

You will be required to show photo ID to the event staff / volunteer and in exchange for your received waiver, you will receive everything you need to race.

WHERE: 
Location will be announced at a later date. 

DOWNLOAD WAIVER

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

If you do not pick up your racer packet prior to race day you must bring a copy of your registration / ticket with you on race day; those who do not have a copy of this or a racer packet will be charged a spectator fee.  

Spectators must bring a printed or digital copy of their ticket.

What is the refund policy?

There are NO refunds any circumstances. 

What is the course distance?

7km
181742158693171.location: Napean National Equestrian Park, 401 Corkstown Road, Ottawa, CA
181742158693171.name: Ottawa BADASS Dash

194838854057997.description:
Set in the year 2054, there was a horrible mistake genetically created in a lab in the capital, Ottawa. Scientist Eugene Melnick attempted to create a product that would enhance your appearance & make you the perfect somebody. Something went wrong, & the product - instead of creating perfection, caused horrific deformities & an uncontrollable desire for human flesh. You are now one of the few remaining survivors, will you run, or will you hide? Will you remain loyal to your group? You have one immunity injection left, will you end your team-mates life and extend 
the duration of your own? Or will sacrifice your own life to let your team-mates live? The choice is yours, so choose wisely.

find us:
ON SATURDAY, JUNE 28TH WE WILL BE MEETING OUTSIDE THE TIM HORTONS ON HUNTCLUB! from there, we will be walking to the woods. We will be holding up a sign, don't wory  
You must be there at exactly 12:00-12:05pm, otherwise we're walking without ya! 

--> http://prntscr.com/2o49ri
--> Buses 116 & 147 will take you here.
--> for more info; Justin Beres

▲ #OTTAWAINFECTED2014 ▲

The Two Roles:

Zombies: Your Goal is to capture the Survivor's flags. You are highly encouraged to go all out with your costumes and make-up to make this a realistic adventure. At 30 minutes into the round, you will hear a loud horn - this signifies that you must now scavenge for survivors in a horde. Rally up all your fellow zombies. This will last for 25 minutes. At the end of the round, the zombie with the most flags will be awarded a prize.

Survivors: Your goal is to hide out from the Zombie's for two and a half hours. You will be given (A) flag upon your entry into the game this is your ''immunity''. If this is removed from your waist, you have lost and must make your way back to base. AKA out of the forest - once there tell one of the organizers (in the plain white shirts that you've been caught.)  There is no Dress Code. Last team or person last standing will be awarded a Prize.

Keep in mind that this is more than a game of tag, it's a role-play! 

WE ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR:
-Lost or stolen items
-Any injuries that may occur

We recommend you bring:
-A backpack
-LOTS of water
-Appropriate clothing according to the weather
-Lunch
-Snacks
-A good attitude

RULES: 
-Must be at least 15 years of age or attending with a parent or guardian. 
-Minimum players to each group is 3, maximum is 4. 
-No alcohol 
-No drugs
-No weapons
-No fighting
-No sexual activity 
-No one under the influence of drugs and/or alcohol will be allowed to play 
-If you or someone in your group is badly injured, make sure one person stays with them at all times, and send another off to seek help. 
-If the rest of your group gets caught & you are left by yourself, you can choose to play on your own at your own risk, or forfeit and make your way back to home base. 

To find out more & to reserve your spot, please visit our website:
www.ottawainfected.co.vu

- Volunteering Applications NOW Available.
194838854057997.name: #OTTAWA INFECTED 2014

196590983869148.description:
EVENT DETAILS:
**********************

Re: 96 hour protest May 1 until May 4th 2014.
---------------------------------------------------------------

Our protest is called World Wide March Waking Up The Masses. It was originally the World Wide March Against Corruption combined with the Omnibus March Against Harper in Canada.  The goal of waking up the masses through protest is education of the corruption going on in Canada and around the world. Although this is happening in many locations in Canada we would like as many Canadians that can make the trip to Ottawa for this protest as possible to come.

Throughout the event there will be all ministers, military officials, diplomats, and special guests arriving in Ottawa. We have a permit for a peaceful protest and welcome all groups, families and individuals to join us. 

During the day from 7am until 9pm we will be protesting on Parliament Hill with marches every 2 hours one group from Parliament hill to the human rights monument on Lisgar and Elgin. Also a second group Marching from Parliament Hill to 58 George street in the Byward Market. Of course back to Parliament Hill again. 

At 9pm each night we will be on the Wellington street side of the gate. On the sidewalks until 7am each morning. Then we will move back to the Parliament Hill Side. During the evening on the Wellington street side we will be protesting and sleeping/sitting in chairs or standing. We will leave enough room for pedestrians to be able to also use the sidewalk. I have spoken with the Ottawa police as we have discussed and informed them of all this.  We have been peaceful, polite and cleaned up our mess. This time will be no different.

On May 4, 2014 ; we are aware there is another event taking place on Parliament Hill. For this day we have reserved the North West side of Wellington street and Metcalfe for our protest. That would be from approx 7am until 3pm. It is right where all the ministers, military, diplomats and guest speakers will be hosting their event. The will see and hear everything we are doing.

Our group is more than happy to work with all people, groups and organizations who want to stop government corruption to make this a constructive, peaceful protest. Please contact the Admins if you have any questions.
Also, please join the Canada event page : 
https://www.facebook.com/events/1473029886258968/
You can find the list of locations in Canada on the top post of the Canada page. 
Please note the description for the march is different on the Canada page, which is mainly focused on  taking down Harper and stopping the pipeline....for the world. 
We are all in this together. 

***************************************************************

Once again let us unite all groups for this event. Every one is welcome. Everyone is welcome. All groups and organizations.

THIS TIME IT IS A 4 DAY EVENT TO REALLY WAKE UP THE MASSES. NOT EVERYONE CAN BE THERE ALL FOUR DAYS BUT PLEASE COME OUT AS MUCH AS YOU CAN DURING THE 4 DAY EVENT!


Peace and respect to everyone.

****************************************************************

Please meet at Parliament Hill near the flame at noon. Please dress the weather. Please bring water to drink and signs to display. We will protest on the hill. We will be contacting media to let them know we will be there protesting against our government for their corruption. Bring Cameras if you wish and this will be peaceful but it is a good thing to have a buddy system. I also ask that people bring a garbage bag or two. We would like to keep the area clean. This is our planet we don't want to mess it up ;)

****************************************************************
THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO MARCHED ON MARCH 1, 2014 FOR THE WORLD WIDE MARCH AGAINST GOVERNMENT CORRUPTION. WE ARE SO PROUD OF ALL OF YOU! 
Please see the Canada Slideshow on the Canada page as well as the World Wide slideshow and video accessible on the World Wide main event page.
196590983869148.name: OTTAWA, ONTARIO CANADA World Wide March Waking Up The Masses
