312246205584072.description:
Mesdames, mesdemoiselles et messieurs,

C'est avec beaucoup d'émoi que je vous invite chaleureusement au lancement officiel de mon recueil «L'éveil stellaire» à Ottawa. C'est avec une fierté difficilement exprimable que je vous montrerai pour la première fois mes «enfants», les premiers, j'ose espérer, d'une longue lignée. 

Au passage, j'aimerais vous encourager vivement à amener des amis avec vous, car plus on est de fous, plus on rit, n'est-ce pas? Le programme de la soirée est simple : discours inaugural suivi d'un récital de quelques poèmes choisis spécialement pour l'occasion, puis séance d'autographes et paiement des recueils.

Venons-en aux informations pratiques.

La soirée aura lieu au local 509 du pavillon des Arts de l'Université d'Ottawa, qui donne sur l'avenue Laurier Est. Je vous recommande donc de vous rendre au lancement en autobus, afin d'éviter tous les ennuis liés au stationnement. 

Pour ceux qui ont réservé un exemplaire, il sera payable sur réception du livre à la soirée au coût de 15$. Exceptionnellement, ceux qui achèteront sur place payeront aussi ce prix, mais mon recueil coûtera ensuite 20$.

Finalement, n'oubliez pas d'apporter un peu de ce coeur d'enfant qui s'émerveille devant tout que vous portez tous au creux de votre être...

Au plaisir de vous voir en grand nombre le jeudi 27 mars 2014 au soir!

* * *Estherstellairement vôtre* * *
312246205584072.location: 70, avenue Laurier Est, pavillon des Arts de l'Université d'Ottawa
312246205584072.name: Lancement - Ottawa

312886545527711.description:
À la suite de la fameuse « crise économique » de 2008, les gouvernements, à travers le monde, appliquèrent et appliquent toujours des mesures d’austérité. Celles-ci se traduisent, au Québec, par des hausses de tarif (garderies, électricité, éducation), ainsi que par des coupures dans les services sociaux sous l’égide des partis libéral et québécois. Au niveau fédéral, les mesures d’austérité ont un visage semblable par l’entremise de coupes dans les services (abolition de la poste porte-à-porte) et les emplois, coupes effectuées par le gouvernement conservateur Harper. Ce dernier s’érige en adversaire contre les travailleuses et travailleurs ainsi que contre leur syndicat. De plus, le laissez-faire écologique des gouvernements québécois et canadien est une attaque directe sur la survie de l’humanité. 
   Camarades! Défendons-nous contre les forces néolibérales qui attaquent nos droits innés et qui pillent notre merveilleuse Terre! Formons un bloc solidaire et populaire. Combattons pour une société démocratique et égalitaire! Sortons le 1er mai avec le poing en l’air!
312886545527711.name: Journée internationale des travailleurs-ses de Gatineau-Ottawa

369035013235406.description:
Je me rendrai dans la région de Gatineau / Hull / Ottawa le vendredi 18 avril prochain (vendredi de Pâques) pour des séances d'Alignements Alpha. Une amie qui habite à Hull, m'a invité à tenir un événement chez elle, soit également un endroit où il se déroule régulièrement des cours de méditation dans cette région. Comme tous les événements d'Alignement Alpha, l'ambiance sera d'avantage amicale que formelle. 

L'Alignement Alpha agit sur les niveaux physique, mental, émotionnel, spirituel, structurel, musculaire, vasculaire et chimique. Il se focalise sur la bonne relation entre le corps et l'esprit, et comment cette interrelation peut affecter nos fonctions vitales et notre performance humaine dans tous les domaines de notre vie. C'est un processus ...par lequel les blocages et les restrictions de la bonne circulation de l'énergie vitale (Life Energy) sont temporairement retirées, permettant ainsi à l'énergie de s'écouler plus librement dans toutes les parties du corps. En conséquence, vous retrouvez le bien-être, la bonne humeur et la joie de vivre que vous aviez du temps de votre enfance.

Lorsque vous êtes calmes, votre intelligence innée travaille pour vous en temps réel, dans l'instant présent, de manière équilibrée et naturelle, d'une façon qui peut vous empêcher de vivre dans l'agitation excessive des pensées, de réagir de façon exagérées aux formes de stress subtiles, aux situations négatives de la vie et de se replier dans un monde isolé parce que le cerveau est verrouillé. L'Alignement Alpha offre un moyen de résoudre les difficultés de votre vie et de réaliser pleinement votre potentiel. C’est ce qu’on appelle le rythme alpha, qui sont des ondes plus douces et relaxantes.

J'invite mes ami(e)s à découvrir l'Alignement Alpha. Vous aurez l'occasion d'expérimenter un état d'être énergétique nouveau grâce aux ondes alpha et la possibilité de vous sentir différent, plus positif et plus heureux.

Voici les commentaires des amis qui expérimentent régulièrement l'alignement alpha : http://www.alignementalpha.ca/#!les-commentaires-des-amis/cqaz

Une présentation détaillé de l'Alignement Alpha ici :
http://www.alignementalpha.ca/#!Une-prsentation-dtaille-de-lAlignement-Alpha/cpz2/1
_____________________________________________________
Détails de l'événement du 18 avril:

Pour les nouveaux à l'Alignement Alpha, il y aura 2 opportunités de participer dans la même journée (2 groupes): Une séance d'information obligatoire suivie d’alignements aura lieu à 13:00. En confirmant votre présence directement sur l'événement, SVP publier une note qu'il s'agit de votre première expérience etsi vous venez accompagnés, SVP indiquer le nombre de personnes qui seront avec vous. La séance d’introduction à l’Alignement Alpha (information, évaluation + 3 alignements) coûte $150.00, normalement l'introduction (première séance) compte 2 alignements. Si vous désirez approfondir l'expérience, il sera possible de le faire, nous en discuterons sur place et évaluerons les possibilités. Les deux séances d'information sont également ouvertes aux personnes qui souhaitent uniquement en savoir d'avantage sur le stress, l'énergie, l'équilibre corps/esprit et comment fonctionne l'Alignement Alpha.

Pour les personnes déjà familières avec l'Alignement Alpha, je peux vous recevoir entre 15 :00 et 17 :00 (dernier début de RV), je vous prie de confirmer votre présence directement sur l'événement et de préciser l'heure qui vous convient. Vous pouvez également m'envoyer un message privé ou me contacter au 418-951-4559 pour prendre RV. À la base, je vous offre 3 alignements pour $100.00 plutôt que 2. Si vous désirez approfondir l'expérience, il sera possible de le faire, vous pouvez communiquer avec moi par message privé ou nous pouvons en discuter sur place le 25 avril et évaluerons les possibilités. 

Pour tous: C'est moitié prix pour les conjoints et conjointes qui vous accompagne et c'est gratuit pour les enfants de moins de 16 ans qui sont accompagnés d'un parent.


Pour en savoir +++ visitez Patrice, Praticien Alpha :
https://www.facebook.com/patrice.trudeau

www.AlignementAlpha.ca


Centre Énergie Alpha de Québec avec Patrice Trudeau JJ.
369035013235406.name: DÉCOUVERTE & EXPÉRIENCE ALPHA à Hull/Gatineau/Ottawa avec Patrice.

We are having an open meeting of the newly reorganized Ottawa's Really Really Free Market, Saturday March 29th @ 9:30 a.m.

206 Montreal Road, please use the side entrance of St. Margaret's Anglican Church with the wheel chair access as that is the location of the meeting room.

OR you can contact the markets volunteer coordinator Lisa Latulip via email lexismum@live.ca

The meeting will include an overall explanation of the market.  The purpose and direction as well as offering information on general freecycling and sustainability.

We will be signing up volunteers for the Market and you will require your email information and contact information.  Shirt size and what hours you are able to work.

ALL STUDENTS ARE WELCOME TO VOLUNTEER AND WE WILL BE POSTING A SEPARATE NOTICE ON ALL ONLINE VENUES FOR OUR STUDENTS.

Our students work very hard and its a wonderful experience for them and it is our pleasure to award them their volunteer hours as the market is a physical and can be fast moving or laid back depending on how our drops come in that day.

We need all the volunteers we can find as we are reorganized, will have proper drop locations and nothing will be accessed until the runner drops the sorted items off at the designated area and the volunteers in charge unload the boxes onto the tables.

Spread the word, Ottawa's Really Really Free Market, the event that you drop what you don't need; and take what you do and every thing is free needs as many of you as we can find to help us give away all that good stuff!

442713782432970.description:
Hey, everyone!

We all know that winter in Ottawa is no picnic, but we are fortunate enough to have a roof over our heads and warm clothes to shelter us from the numbing wind chill and heavy amounts of snow. But the reality is, not everyone is as fortunate as us. Last year, as I was wrapping my homemade scarf around my neck, I started thinking about how I could do something for those who don't have the luxury of warmth and can't afford a Canada Goose jacket.

As some of you know, I crochet a lot – scarves in particular.Last winter I had decided to sell my scarves. For every scarf that I make and sell, I am going to make another scarf to donate to a homeless person. If you are familiar with Toms shoes, it’s basically the same idea – but instead, you will be helping someone right here in Ontario! So, not only will you be keeping yourself warm, but you will also be helping someone on the streets stay warm.

 I can make your personal scarf with any colour you’d like.  I can also make infinity/circle scarves. If you would like anything fancier it will cost a little more.
Each scarf costs $20.  I make them approx. 56 inches in length. 

If you are interested in buying a scarf, send me a personal message. here is the link to the colours you can choose from for your scarf.

Indie Montréal présente/ presents...


DAVID MARTEL   (Indie Folk/Rock  |  Montréal / Melbourne)
www.iamdavidmartel.com

+

THE GALLOP   (Indie Rock  |  Ottawa)
http://thegallopmusic.com

+

WHAT IF ELEPHANTS    (Indie Rock/Pop  |  Montréal/Ottawa)
https://www.facebook.com/whatifelephants



Billets / Tickets:
$10.00 à l’avance / in advance
au/ at:  http://indiemontreal.ca/?p=6807


$12.00 à la porte / at the door (s’il en reste / if not sold out)



Les portes ouvrent à 20h00 et le spectacle commence à 21h00 / Doors open at 8:00 pm and the show starts at 9:00 pm


***************************************************



En 2008, David Martel à boulversé la scène musical de Montréal avec la sortie de son premier enregistrement, Hardly Knew Me. Il a continué son ascension en réalisant une tournée en Amerique du nord et en France, en se faisant remarquer lors de festival comme le SXSW ( États-Unis ), le NXNE ( Canada ), et le MIDEM (France ). En 2009, il part en tournée avec Mother Mother et réalise la première partie d’Adele devant une salle comble au Massey Hall de Toronto. Lors de l’été 2011, il sort un Ep auto-produit nommé You’ve Heard the Best, Now try The Rest… trés bien recu par le public et repart en tournée à travers le Quebec et l’Ontario. Il passe l’année 2012 en pre-production de son dernier album qu’il vient de finir d’enregistrer au Break Glass Studio avec le producteur et chanteur de  Besnard Lakes, Jace Lasek (Land of Talk, Sunns). Préparez vous car une nouvelle vague de liberation arrive bientôt dans votre ville.

---------------

In 2008, David Martel exploded onto Montreal's music scene with the release of his first and critically aclaimed record, Hardly Knew Me.He followed up with tours across North America and France, hitting up and leaving his mark at major industry festivals; such as SXSW (USA), NXNE (Canada), and MIDEM (France). In 2009 he toured with Mother Mother, and opened for Adele in front of a sold-out audience at Toronto's Massey Hall. In the summer of 2011, he released a self-produced EP You've Heard the Best, Now Try the Rest... With another well-received release under his belt, he continued to build an audience and make waves, touring around Quebec and Ontario. In 2012, he spend most of the year in pre-production for his next full-length album which he just finished recording at Break Glass Studios with producer and Besnard Lakes frontman, Jace Lasek (Land of Talk, Suuns). Keep your eyes and ears healthy and warm, because another wave of awesome is coming to your town with another David Martel release. 


www.iamdavidmartel.com



***************************************************


UNE PRÉSENTATION DE / PRESENTED BY


INDIE MONTRÉAL

www.indiemontreal.ca

http://twitter.com/indiemontreal

Page: www.facebook.com/IndieMontreal

Group: 'Montreal Indie Music Network' on Facebook




19+

451834044950020.description:
Join us at Arts Court for an inspiring night of live competitive painting! 

The painters and audiences have been absolutely amazing in Canada's Capital and we can't wait to be back at the easels on Saturday March 29th. 12 professional and emerging painters will compete to become the next Art Battle champion, the winner earning a cash prize and a spot in the Ottawa Championship in June 2014. The winner of the Ottawa Final will compete in the 2014 National Championship.

Congratulations to Richard Morrissette, winner of February's Art Battle 99!  Here is the review of his win and the event in the Ottawa Citizen > http://www.ottawacitizen.com/mobile/news/ottawa/Battle+Ottawa/9540790/story.html

To paint with Art Battle in Ottawa or another city, please visit our application page at http://artbattle.ca/register

Our promotional partners, the AOE Arts Council (AOE) have been serving the Ottawa arts community for 25 years. AOE represents a bilingual membership of over 450 artists, organizations and supporters. Visit www.artsoe.ca to learn more.

WHAT IS ART BATTLE?

Art Battle is live competitive painting. Painters create the best work they can in 20 minutes. As they work, patrons move around the easels, closely watching the creative process. The medium is acrylic paint and the tools allowed are brushes, palette knives or any non-mechanical implements. At the end of the round, the audience votes democratically for their favourite painting and bids in silent auction to take the work home. This is Art Battle Canada’s 5th season and first full season in Ottawa.

Art Battle 111
Saturday, March 29th 7pm
Arts Court, 2 Daly Ave
Tickets 15$ door/10$ Limited Advance online
$10 at the door for Students and Seniors

BRUTAL CHERIE have been playing tons of shows since 2010 in Quebec and also touring Europe.  They've played festivals like POUZZA FEST, AMNESIA  ROCKFEST, and have played shows with such bands as DIRECT HIT!, MASKED INTRUDER, SNUFF, STRUNG OUT, THE FLATLINERS, and too many more to name.

DILLINGER FOUR, CHIXDIGGIT, MAD CADDIES, SNFU, DAYGLO ABORTIONS, REAGAN YOUTH, 7 SECONDS, CJ RAMONE, THE MENZINGERS, THE FLATLINERS, THE BRAINS, MUSTARD PLUG, THE HOLY MESS, and too many more to mention here. 460763324056140.description:
We're looking to fill the following positions for the 2014/15 year! Terms run from May 1st-April 30th of the following year.

If you would like to run, please fill out this form: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1zgwK_H5UBMe_MuEUY-0aBLLK4T-IK7t0JnKKD-cH8Xg/viewform

President 
The president oversees the other members of the executive in fulfilling their duties and helps them with setting and achieving their goals. They are responsible for arranging and chairing all executive meetings, ensuring communication within the executive, and meeting with the players' advocates on a regular basis to hear ideas and concerns. (Eligibility: must have held a position on the uOttawa Quidditch exec.)

VP Finance
They are responsible for overseeing the financial aspects of the club. They maintain the books, the bank account, paypal, and set the budget. The VP Finance also holds the purse strings and must decide whether to give approval to purchases.

VP Communications
Acts as the main contact point for the media, manages the club's online and social media presence (our website, facebook page & group, twitter account, etc.). The VP Communications also manages the agenda at meetings and takes the minutes. They are responsible for keeping everyone up to date on what's going on.

VP Social 
Organizes our main events (Snitchmas, Yule Ball, Cub Birthday, Quoscars) as well as smaller events throughout the year.

VP Athletics
Oversees the selection of the coaching staff and represents their interests and the teams' interests to the executive. Is responsible for travel arrangements and accommodations when either of the teams travels to away games.

VP Community
Runs Sunday Funday, or a community social event when practice is impossible, and organizes events with other campus and city groups, inviting them to try quidditch.

VP Sportswear and Goods
Responsible for swag. Swag and fundraising.

Please contact Tegan or Rebecca, co-secs, with questions!

This reception provides an opportunity for interveners, members of the Ottawa immigration bar and law students to debrief after the hearing, and to socialize over refreshments. 

At the end of a very busy year of events, research, and advocacy in the realm of refugee law, the Febles case and this event provide an especially valuable opportunity for the students of our CARL chapter. 468044506655322.description:
Launching Max Haiven's  new book "Crises of Imagination, Crises of Power: Capitalism, Creativity and the Commons" in OTTAWA, Ontario.

ABOUT THE LAUNCH

Saturday, April 12, 11:30am-1:30pm
25One Community, 251 Bank St. (2nd floor)

http://octopusbooks.ca/event/book-launch-crises-imagination-crises-power-capitalism-creativity-and-commons

In partnership with Solidarity against Austerity, Max will be joined by a selection of community activists discussing powerful alternatives to capitalism and social movements!

    Ana Nicole (Peoples Social Forum)
    Diane Mitchell (CUPW)
    Kaitrin Doll (Overbrook Forbes Community Centre)
    Shellie Bird (Solidarity against Austerity)
    Vicky Smallman (TBC)

A skill-building workshop will follow after a short break.

"... the fact that overcoming both sets of crises (those of capital and those of the imagination) demands the intertwined work of rekindling common values; imagining social relations and the future otherwise; and, in a militant and radical way, building powerful alternatives and social movements."  - Max Haiven

Books will be available for sale from Octopus Bookstore (http://octopusbooks.ca/).  To order in Canada, please visit: http://fernwoodpublishing.ca/Crises-of-Imagination-Crises-of-Power/ 

ABOUT THE BOOK

http://www.zedbooks.co.uk/paperback/crises-of-imagination-crises-of-power

"Today, when it seems like everything has been privatized, when austerity is too often seen as an economic or political problem that can be solved through better policy, and when the idea of moral values has been commandeered by the right, how can we re-imagine the forces used as weapons against community, solidarity, ecology and life itself?

In this stirring call to arms, Max Haiven argues that capitalism has colonized how we all imagine and express what is valuable. Looking at the decline of the public sphere, the corporatization of education, the privatization of creativity, and the power of finance capital in opposition to the power of the imagination and the growth of contemporary social movements, Haiven provides a powerful argument for creating an anti-capitalist commons. Capitalism is not in crisis, it is the crisis, and moving beyond it is the only key to survival.

Crucial reading for all those questioning the imposition of austerity and hoping for a fairer future beyond it."

Free and open to all

Max Haiven is an assistant professor in the Division of Art History and Critical Studies at the Nova Scotia College of Art and Design in Halifax. His work has appeared in journals such as Social Text, Cultural Studies, and Mediations. He is the author of Cultures of Financialization (2014) and (with Alex Khasnabish) of The Radical Imagination (Zed Books, 2014).
468044506655322.name: "Crises of Imagination, Crises of Power" by Max Haiven - OTTAWA book launch panel

Book on Uniiverse: https://www.uniiverse.com/listings/4th-annual-yogini-yogathon-ottawa-tickets-ottawa-293MF

    Ottawa's 4th Annual Yogini Yogathon!

Sunday, May 4th, 2014

9-4pm ( Doors open at 8:40am)

Glebe Community Center

175 Third Avenue

613-564-1058

A yoga event exclusively for women!

This Yogini Yogathon is chance for you to spend a day with like-minded women, all putting Yoga into action by coming to together outside studio walls in order to help support empowering women and girls throughout the world.

Together, we are strong. We are resilient. We CAN make a difference.

Join some of Ottawa’s most inspirational women Yoga teachers from studio’s around the city for an exciting day filled with Yoga!

The Yoga community is one of the strongest in NA, and as a community of like-minded, powerful women we are collectively trying to raise money and awareness for 3 amazing local, National, and International causes!

Each participant is encouraged to raise only $108 on their own for Free the Children_ _by either fundraising or personally donating, and part of every commitment is donated on your behalf to two other partner charities!

The participant who goes above and beyond the encouraged amount though,and raises the most for Free the Children, will receive a GRAND PRIZE ~ One Year of FREE Yoga with My Virtual Yoga + more!

We are also raffling off many other prizes from local studio's and stores, such as class packages, mats, and more. 

All fundraising proceeds are going to  _ Free the Children, _an international charity and educational partner, working both domestically and internationally to empower and enable youth to be agents of change.   www.freethechildren.org 
$5 from every Commitment Fee is supporting Amethyst Women's Addiction Center who offers alternative addiction services to women. Amethyst is committed to working with diverse and marginalized groups of women. Our aim is to support women, individually and together, to take control of factors affecting our health and well-being.

www.amethyst-ottawa.org 


$5 from every Commitment Fee is going to ACCESS, which exists to provide young Africans with the education and tools necessary to benefit themselves and their society.

www.accesskenya.org 
    

The Teaching Schedule!

**9-930am ~ Opening Ceremonies**

Welcome & Free the Children's work


**930-10:30am ~ EmpowerFlow with Megan Campbell**

( www.megancampbell.ca )

An all-levels Vinyasa class for women



**10:30-11:30am ~ Flamenco Flow with Ana Skarakis**

( www. yogaparati.ca)

Yoga, flamenco, & Indian dance for women



**11:30-12:30pm ~ Patner Yoga with Jamine Ackhert**

( www.jaminetheyogateacher.com)

Bond with like-minded women 



**12:30-1:30pm ~ Lunch**

Shop for A Cause, raffle for prizes, lunch & massages!



**1:30-2:30pm ~ Forest Yoga with Edith Parinas**

( www. edithparinas.com)

Find your inner strength and intuition



**2:30-3:30pm ~ Happy Hips with Janice Tokaryk**

( www. adishesha.com)

Get hot hips while you wind down and stretch out



**3:30-4pm  ~ Yoga Trance Dance with Jenn Stowe**

( www. jenniferstowe.com)

Partaaayyy and celebration to end the day

    

Please visit www.journeyoftheyogini.com for more details

    

All donations made to Free the Children by you or donors receive a tax deductible receipt. 

 

If you cannot pay by credit card and would like to attend please email  yoginiyogathon@gmail.com 
 

 \* There will be no refunds or transfers for tickets offered once registered. No refunds or transfers offered for donations made to Free the Children, Amethyst or ACCESS.

506444019476221.description:
All are welcome at the Parliament Pub on Monday, March 24 to help launch the official (and fascinating) account of former Senator Mike Duffy and the Senate expense scandal that rocked our country.

Come out to hear author and journalist Dan Leger detail the process of writing a book such as this, the challenges and obstacles faced, and what he hopes to accomplish through its publication. 

Complimentary hors d'ouevres will be served, and Dan will be on-hand to read from and sign copies of his book. 

ABOUT THE BOOK:

Mike Duffy made his name as a political reporter, and in the process became one of Prince Edward Island’s most famous exports. He cast himself as the ultimate insider, Parliament Hill’s man in the know. It made him a household name and one of the Canada’s best-paid journalists. 

But Duffy wanted to get even closer and lobbied his way into the Canadian Senate, with dire results. Veteran journalist Dan Leger tells the story of Duffy’s rise to the top in Canadian media, his entanglement with the Harper Conservatives, and the scandal that made him one of the most controversial figures in contemporary politics. 

Includes a foreword by CBC’s Peter Mansbridge and an eight-page colour photo insert. 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR:

Dan Leger is one of Canada's most versatile journalists. After 12 years reporting for the Canadian Press in Halifax, St. John's, and on Parliament Hill, he moved to the CBC as a producer and executive producer. In 2005, he joined The Chronicle Herald as managing editor and columnist. He is a Gemini Award winner, and holds two Atlantic Journalism Awards for Commentary.
506444019476221.name: DUFFY Ottawa Book Launch with Author Dan Leger

517516998367420.description:
We are a new humanitarian uOttawa club, part of the country-wide organisation Kin Canada (www.kincanada.ca), that is looking for new members and executive team people!

The info. night will have FREE PIZZA + lots of awesome information about what this new club does, what is expected of members, and what are the responsibilities of being on an exec team. 

Here are some brief points to give you an idea about the club:

- We focus on volunteering to serve the community's greatest need, mainly in Canada

- Basically everything is in the hands of the members; you decide what you think is the community's greatest need and what you want to do to help! 

- Examples of events other Kin clubs have done in the past are trivia nights, bar nights, dance parties, mini golf games, winter carnivals, fishing derbies, races, bake-offs, bake sales... basically anything you want!

- There are Kin Canada clubs practically in every city in Canada; volunteering could take you travelling if you want it to, and give you a chance to connect with people and meet friends all over Canada!

Come to the info night to find out more! I look forward to seeing you there :) Feel free to invite your friends!

***Please RSVP to confirm your attendance so we know how much food to get!!***

RainBarrel.ca is pleased to partner with Ottawa Riverkeeper. As an independent voice for the river, Ottawa Riverkeeper provides leadership and inspiration to protect, promote, and improve its ecological health and future. 524904894287375.description:
Students at the University of Ottawa are organizing an event titled Developing Social and Ethical Finance: A New Approach to Investment.

This is a free public conference that will be presented in English.

http://www.eventbrite.ca/e/developing-social-and-ethical-finance-a-new-approach-to-investment-tickets-10611307707

PANELIST
-Me Penelope Simons (Moderator- Associate Professor, Common Law)
-M Cameron Fenton (National Director, Climate Youth Climate Coalition)
-M Karim Harji (Co-Founder of SocialFinance.ca & Capital.ca)
-Dr.Tessa Hebb (Carleton Centre for Community Innovation)
-Mme Nancy Kyte (Senior Portfolio Manager in Treasury, EDC)
-Mme Rosalie Vendette (Senior Advisor Desjardins Investments Inc) 

We hope to stimulate a serious discussion around social and ethical approaches to finance and investment for the purpose of the University of Ottawa Pension Fund to consider agreements such as the UN Global Compact. The University of Ottawa is a signatory to this international agreement. We would sincerely appreciate your voice as a distinguished professional and expert in this industry.

Location:
4101 (4th floor) Desmarais Building, (DMS) - University Of Ottawa - 55 Laurier East Ottawa, Ontario, K1N 6N5

We would like to thank the Graduate Student Association (GSAED), OPIRG (Ontario Public Interest Research Group Ottawa), the School of Management, the Political Studies Department and the Association des étudiant(e)s diplômé(e)s en études politiques.

****

SOCIAL FINANCE AND ETHICAL INVESTMENTS
The boundaries between public and private are blurring with the responsibilities of social development no longer in the hands of government. It is inappropriate for the private sector to safely hide behind Milton Friedman’s assertion that “… the only social responsibility of business is to increase its profits …”1 The students of University of Ottawa are interested in alternative investment options that take into account social and ethical considerations. In the last several decades social finance and ethical investment have become increasingly important and sought after investment methods. For example portfolios with social investment started as early as 1984, which according to the Social Investment Forum worth around 40 billion. A decade later this number grew to $639 billion, while in 2001 it was $2.3 trillion.2 Around the world funds have been organized in national settings like the Pay for Success, funded by the Rockefeller Foundation in the United States.


1.Milton Friedman, Greed is Good, the Social Responsibility of Business is to Increase its Profits, NEW YORK TIMES, 13 September 1970
2.Florini, A., 2003. ‘Business and global governance: the growing role of corporate codes of conduct’, Brookings Review 21 (3)

ETHICAL INVESTING AND SOCIAL FINANCE
America by the new Eduniversal 2013-2014 Masters ranking in the General Management category. The university has made breakthrough advancements in the fields of sciences, social sciences, and health on the global setting. The University`s proximity to Parliament and other national institutions gives it an important role in the formation of developing Canadian policy. Due to Ottawa`s meteoritic rise and commitments to justice there is demand for pursuing socially equitable and progressive Financial policies.


Format of Event
Prominent and distinguished experts will be invited to answer a number of questions moderated by Associate Professor Penelope Simons. Upon the conclusion of the questions, the audience will be encouraged to ask questions. The event will end with a fully catered networking event. 

For more information, please contact Anaïs Elboujdaïni, Student Member of the University of Ottawa, Board of Governors at anaiselboujdaini@gmail.com
524904894287375.location: room 4101 Desmarais Building - University Of Ottawa
524904894287375.name: Developing Social & Ethical Finance: A New Approach to investment - Développer la finance sociale et éthique: une nouvelle approche à l'investissement

531517536969238.description:
*** Mugshots Presents..  The Tea Light Concert Series! ***

As host of 'Open Mic Wednesdays' for three years, I've had the opportunity to see many performers from all over this city (and beyond) perform their hearts out and show up almost every wednesday to do what they love. Many artists have left an impression on me as well as the staff at Mugshots, and we are always left wanting a little bit more. The Tea Light Concert Series is a monthly showcase that features artists who've played the open mic and who have demonstrated true skill and talent over the years and who simply deserve more spotlight.

Join us for our second event, April 10th!!

Featuring:

Just Friends 
(Jeff & Dave Watkins, Sara Baar) A harmony of voices, instruments, friends, and fun sing songs. "

Andrew Johnson
http://www.reverbnation.com/andrewjohnsonmusic

Andrew Johnson is an artist singer/songwriter originally from the Ottawa Valley. Spiralling straightforward, full of 'soul' folk music - a psychedelic experience. He is currently working with several producers as well as with a band of wide variety, an eclectic collective of like minded musicians, a powerhouse of potential creating a poetic symphony for the senses. Introducing a unique fusion of the many styles and genres that shape our creative outlook of today and focusing on a new direction with his projects, Andrew is working towards a sustainable community and being able to share the feeling with the world

Mark Fossen
http://www.markfossen.com/

In the summer of 2009, Fossen left his suburban nine-to-five and moved into the heart of Vancouver's creative district with a clean slate, a guitar, and an optimistic uncertainty that this was to be his best decision to date.

For the next three years, he would spend his days transforming busy street corners into peaceful listening stations and romantic piers into intimate stages—one street performance at a time.

Funded through the generous support of passersby, Fossen produced and released his debut EP "Villains" in December of 2011, which features a collection of songs from this period spent singing on the world's sidewalks. He is happy to know that people all over the globe are in possession of his music today.

Now residing in Ottawa, he is presently preparing his next release with the help of engineer/producer Dave Meszaros of Watershed Productions in Vancouver.  - See more at: http://www.markfossen.com/bio/#sthash.v6Sgi8q1.dpuf

$7  //   75 Nicholas 
Doors 8pm // Show starts at 9pm
Thursday, April 10th 2014

See you Thursday!!
Sincerely,
Claude Munson
531517536969238.name: [Mugshots Presents: The Tea Light Concert Series] APRIL EDITION!

553341734781799.description:
It is time for a changing of the guard! On April 13th the rookies of the club will take on the veterans for the title of Best Generation of Quidditch Players in the UOttawa Quidditch club.

What is the event you may ask? Well it will a full scale quidditch match between the members of the club. Whoever wins the game will be crowned the Best Generation of Quidditch Players.

How do you know which team you are on? Well the teams will be divided as follows:

Team Fresh as Morning Dew:
- Current uOttawa Quidditch club member
- Anyone who has not attended a World Cup before World Cup VII.
WEAR A DARK COLOURED SHIRT, BLACK OR DARK BLUE PREFERRED 

Team Aged Like a Fine Wine:
- Current UOttawa Quidditch club member
or
- uOttawa Quidditch alumni
and
- Played or volunteered at World Cup VI or earlier
or
- Been a member of the club for 2 or more seasons (joined March 2012 or earlier)
WEAR A LIGHT COLOURED SHIRT, WHITE PREFERRED

Any and all members of the club are invited to take part in the game regardless of skill level. The game will use the official IQA rules, which includes FULL CONTACT. If you wish to PARTICIPATE WITHOUT FULL CONTACT, please message Carina Hetherton or Adam William Robillard and they will make sure you receive a special pinnie day of to ensure players know you are playing non-contact (you will get to participate in the same game as everyone else and will not get hit).

The number of games we play will depend on numbers and conditions day of. Winners will receive eternal glory.

See you there!
553341734781799.name: UOttawa Quidditch: 1st Annual Changing of the Guard Showdown

554089734709897.description:
It's that time again (cue long intro)!

So no one told you Lent was gonna be this way! It's like you're always stuck in second gear and your love life is a... scratch that. Frassati & St. Joe's are there for you! The APB PARTY is back! With a new theme... FRIENDS (cue IMDB for anyone born after '95)!

Friends are important - they're those people who tell you the honest truth about yourself, such as: 
- you look ugly in in plaid
- that cold sore can't be passed of as a mole
- that horrible smell in the room is actually coming from you 
- everyone knows you have a crush on Matt Marchand!

If you have such people in your life, then do them a favour by inviting them to the LAST EVER APB HOSTED BY FRASSATI & ST. JOES! That's right, St. Joe's will be closing their doors once & for all this May! Hence why we picked the long-running sitcom as the theme.

If your friends have kept you in the dark and you've never been to a Frassati/St. Joe's party, you can expect live music, a loud dance floor and of course, one large, roasted PIG! 

We're going to shut St. Joe's down in style and we want you to join us! Because we'll always be there for you... or at least until end of the month...

So help us BLOW UP  this BLOW OUT event, 'cause it's gonna be... FRIENDLY!

**This is a BYOB event. Please drink responsibly.**

554089734709897.name: ALLELUIA PORK & BEER

562667470493375.description:
This workshop is presented by Mouvement in partnership with La Caravan Dance Theatre

Impermanence– 5Rhythms movement workshop
with Evangelos Diavolitsis (La Dance Caravan Theatre, Calgary)

Workshop description:
Everything is changing. Sometimes faster that we wish. We never know what may come next. We try to hold on but nothing really lasts unchanged and we are never certain how things will unfold…

Using music and the 5Rhythms® Movement Wheel of Flowing Staccato Chaos Lyrical and Stillness we explore how our life is a wave of changing vibrations all around and learn to use our bodies to navigate through our lives effectively.  

Friday, April 11 to Sunday, April 13, 2014
Friday 7:00 - 9:30 pm
Saturday 11:00 am - 6:00 pm
Sunday 11:00 am - 6:00 pm

NEW LOCATION - centrally located at:
Ottawa Shambhala Meditation Centre
984 Wellington St W, Ottawa, ON K1Y 2X8

$225 Earlybird by March 1
$250 payment after
$35 Friday only

registration
Visa & M/C in person or by phone: 819-205-0979
By mail: Send cheque to Mouvement, 69, rue Eddy, Gatineau, QC J8x 2W1
Online at: TBC
75% refundable until April 4
Space is limited so please register early.
Or pay and register by paypal: http://clients.mindbodyonline.com/ws.asp?studioid=25616&stype=-103&sTG=27&sVT=36&sView=day&sTrn=100000048&sDate=4/11/2014

About Evangelos
Evangelos is a certified 5Rhythms® facilitator and meditation teacher who trained directly with Gabrielle Roth.  He creates an atmosphere that is adventurous and safe, weaving a delicate chemistry of humour and intensity. He has taught across Canada, Asia, Europe and the U.S. www.dharmainmotion.com
~~~~~~::~~~~~~

Cet atelier est présenté par le Studio Mouvement en partenariat avec La Caravan Dance Theatre.

Impermanence– Un atelier la danse les 5Rhythms® avec Evangelos Diavolitsis (La Dance Caravan Theatre, Calgary)

“Quand nous dansons les 5Rhythms®, le corps devient notre chemin spirituel.” "Danser les 5Rhythms®, c’est découvrir sa propre danse."

Dans nos vies au rythme effréné, le changement s’avère la seule certitude. Tout change autour de nous; souvent, cela se produit plus rapidement que l’on aimerait. On ne sait jamais ce qui nous attend. On tente de s’accrocher aux choses, aux images, aux sentiments, aux gens... mais rien ne persiste longtemps dans le même état, sans se modifier et on en ignore le dénouement. Cette incertitude crée de l’anxiété chez certains….Quiconque se rend compte qu’il (ou elle) a perdu quelque chose qu’il (ou elle) chérissait et tenait pour acquise pour toujours, découvre finalement que rien ne lui appartient vraiment.

Dans le cadre de cet atelier, nous emploierons musique et la méthode des 5Rhythms® (fluide, staccato, chaos, lyrique et quiétude) pour explorer en quoi notre vie est une vague omniprésente de vibrations en évolution.

Du 11 au 13 avril 2014
vendredi :: 19 h 00 - 21 h 30
samedi: : 11 h 00 - 18 h 00
dimanche :: 11 h 00 - 18 h 00
225$ avant le 1er mars
250 $ après le 1er mars 
35 $ vendredi seulement

où :

984 Wellington St W, Ottawa, ON K1Y 2X8

L'espace étant limité, veuillez régler d’avance pour assurer votre place.*cet atelier est offert en anglais.

ABOUT
About Ottawa Explosion Weekend (OXW)
Ottawa Explosion Weekend 2014 will be the fourth edition of this yearly festival. OXW is a celebration of independent music in the punk/garage/hardcore/weirdo vein with a focus on local & canadian bands while still including up and coming bands from the US.

 Past performers include Metz, The Men, Mean Jeans, Night Birds, Iron Chic, Bad Sports, Omegas, Nude Beach, Vacation & a bunch more of new and exciting bands from Ottawa, Montreal & Toronto and as far as San Francisco & Hamburg.

The festival is organized by a small group of passionate people and the help of volunteers to pull together this multi day/multi venue affair.

Poster & logo by Curtis Delaney http://pizzatrip.tumblr.com

567156043380866.description:
Every year, the Student Refugee Program (SRP) welcomes one to two refugee students to the University of Ottawa, where their tuition is waived for two years, and their expenses are covered for the first year. This program is made possible with the support of the uOttawa administration and the World University Service of Canada (WUSC).  Most importantly, it is made possible by the $1.27 student levy every uOttawa student contributes each year to the SRP.

Next year, we would like to generate enough support to raise the student levy, so that uOttawa can sponsor additional refugees to come and study, and so that we can become a leading Canadian university with a well recognized and respected Student Refugee Program.  This will not be possible without bringing more attention to the SRP, which began back in 1988, and has already changed the lives of dozens of youth refugees.

Please stop by sometime between 11 am and 3 pm March 18-20 to learn more about this great program, and how raising the student levy will help ensure its success.
567156043380866.name: uOttawa Student Refugee Program - Mock Refugee Campus

574233772691945.description:
Around the country and across the world, groups of women are coming together once a month on or near the New or Full Moon, to create a safe, nurturing, healing space by women for women. In Ottawa we are meeting on Friday following the New Moon.

Here we can gather to spend some quiet time together, share some snacks, journal or do some creative work, rest our head in a sister's laps, come to dance and move, sing our sacred songs, share our stories, educate and mentor our young daughters and sisters, listen to each other.

The Ottawa Red Tent is a 'by donation' event. Donations will be welcomed to cover expenses of room rental & supplies (suggested $7-10).

Come. Bring your mother, your sisters, your daughters (of menstruation age), and most of all yourselves. Bring your stories, your talents, your abilities, and your receptivity. The Red Tent Temple is open to all women under the common ground we share of our desire to connect, our deep caring for others and our need for taking care of ourselves. Babes in arms/nurslings also welcome.

*please also bring;
- some snacks to share 
- your own plate/bowl & cup
- anything you'd like to share with others

read more about the Red Tent Movement;

http://alisastarkweather.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=blogcategory&id=25&Itemid=48

http://www.facebook.com/RedTentsInEveryNeighborhood?ref=ts&fref=ts

Please RSVP for location directions if it's your first time.
6.30-9.30pm.

If you are able to lend a hand in preparing or with an activity during the night, or for preparations before the event please say. I am always SUPER grateful for anyone who can be there to help set up - anytime from 5.30pm ish.

*thanks to Angie Twydall for the use of her lovely image from her red tent in Kent, in the UK.

**please do let me know if you need to change plans and can't make it -  it affects set up and preparation plans for me - thank you :)
574233772691945.name: May 2nd Ottawa Red Tent

575667532517348.description:
It's almost the equinox, so let's celebrate the passing of the dark with readings from Ian Rogers (Every House Is Haunted, the Felix Renn series), Alison Sinclair (Darkborn, Lightborn, Shadowborn) and Sandra Kasturi (The Animal Bridegroom, Come Late to the Love of Birds).

Plus, Nicole Lavigne will entertain us with a story of the hat!

Alison's new book, Breakpoint: Nereis (Bundoran Press Publishing House), will be available here before it hits stores!

ChiSeries Ottawa receives funding support from the Ontario Arts Council.

Starts at 7PM at Maxwell's on Elgin, but come earlier and join authors, guests and regulars for a drink or meal.

This event, as always, is free.

Ian Rogers is an award-winning Canadian writer. His debut collection, Every House Is Haunted, was the winner of the 2013 ReLit Award in the Short Fiction category, while his novelette, “The House on Ashley Avenue,” was a finalist for the Shirley Jackson Award. His short fiction has been published in Cemetery Dance, Broken Pencil, Shadows & Tall Trees, and has been reprinted in several best-of-the-year anthologies. Ian is also the author of SuperNOIRtural Tales, a collection of stories featuring occult detective Felix Renn. Ian lives with his wife in Peterborough, Ontario. For more information, visit ianrogers.ca. 

Alison Sinclair has published science fiction novels Legacies, Blueheart, and Cavalcade, and Throne Price (co-authored), and fantasy novels Darkborn, Lightborn, and Shadowborn. Cavalcade was shortlisted for the Arthur C. Clarke award in 1999 and her short story "Suspended Lives", about a surgeon working in space, appeared in the Aurora-award winning anthology Space, Inc. (edited by Julie Czerneda). She has degrees in biochemistry, medicine and epidemiology, and her website is at www.alisonsinclair.ca.

Sandra Kasturi is a poet, writer, book reviewer and Bram Stoker Award-winning editor. She is the co-publisher of the World Fantasy Award-nominated and British Fantasy Award-winning press, ChiZine Publications. Her work has appeared in various venues, including ON SPEC, Prairie Fire, Shadows & Tall Trees, several Tesseracts anthologies, Evolve, Evolve 2, Chilling Tales, A Verdant Green, Star*Line, and 80! Memories & Reflections on Ursula K. Le Guin, and the upcoming Vamps, Tramps and Stamps. Sandra’s two poetry collections were released by Tightrope Books: The Animal Bridegroom (with an intro by Neil Gaiman) and Come Late to the Love of Birds. She likes red lipstick, gin & tonics and Michael Fassbender.
575667532517348.name: ChiSeries Ottawa Presents: Ian Rogers, Alison Sinclair and Sandra Kasturi

577453182350500.description:
Friday, June 27th (New Moon)
PranaShanti Yoga Centre 
52 Armstrong St
Ottawa, ON
7:30pm
Cost $30/person
(613) 761-9642 to reserve

What You Can Expect From Crystal Journey:

The show will take place in two 40 to 50 minute sets. David's usual set up includes 10-12 Quartz Crystal Bowls, 8-10 Paiste Planet Gongs &  Santoor (Persian & Indian) Nothing is amplified, pre-recorded or rehearsed. Each set and performance is sonically pure and unique. You can purchase CDs and other merchandise at the shows with cash or cheque or online with a credit card.

We invite you to take a seat or lay down as close to the instruments as possible to get the greatest effect. Remember to bring a yoga mat, blanket and/or pillow as most venues will have floor space to lay down. Chairs for regular seating are also available. Where possible we encourage you to share rides and car pool. It not only saves gas but helps to reduce our carbon foot print on the earth and traffic.

__________________________________________________

About The Instruments:


Paiste Gongs:

Planet Gongs are tuned to the natural harmonic series based on the orbital properties of the Earth, Moon, Sun, and Planets. All of these gongs resonate in harmony with the celestial bodies and communicate a distinct aspect of the Music of the Spheres, which was first documented by Pythagoras in the 6th Century BC. Each planet gong contributes a vital pitch to the total harmonic resonance of our solar system.

Crystal Bowls:

The bowls are made of 99.992% crushed quartz crystal that is heated to 4000 degrees in a centrifugal mold. The thickness of the bowl determines the note, digitally tuned to C D E F G A and B corresponding to the charkas, our energy centers; root (C), sacral (D), solar plexus (E), heart (F), throat (G), third eye (A), and crown (B). The diameter of the bowl determines the pitch, ranging from 6 inches to 22 inches.

The archetype of the instrument may be seen in a harp, carried horizontally and struck with two sticks, found in iconographical documents of the ancient Babylonian (1600-911 BCE) and neo-Assyrian (911-612 BCE) eras.

Indian Santoor (Santour)

The origin of the instrument is clear.  The name, structure, and technique point solidly to the Middle East.  Yet, there are those who attempt to trace its origins to an ancient Indian harp like instrument known as "Vana Veena".  There is absolutely no evidence for this latter view.  If we are to accept this proposition, then how are we to explain its 2000 year disappearance, followed by a miraculous reappearance in a form and usage that, by mere coincidence, is similar to the middle eastern santur?  It is clear that attempts to link the santur with this Vedic instrument are mere wishful thinking.  There are many people who cannot accept the concept of something great developing outside of India.

Santur is an instrument indigenous to Kashmir, but nowadays played throughout the North.  It is a hammered dulcimer which is struck with light wooden mallets.  The number of strings may be as few as 24 or more than 100.  Typical sizes tend to be around 80.  It has a vibrant tone and has become very popular in the last 20 years.

One must not confuse the Indian santur with the Persian santur.  The Indian santur is box-like while the Persian version is much wider.

Persian Santoor:

Persian santoor consists of a trapeziform case made of walnut wood, approximately 90 cm wide at the broad end, 36 cm wide at the narrow end and 6 cm deep. The strings are fixed to hitch-pins along the left-hand side and wound round metal wrest-pins on the right by means of which they are tuned with a tuning-key (Tuning Wrench). Each quadruple set of strings rests on a movable bridge of hardwood (kharak). The bridges are placed so that the strings are divided into three sections, giving the fundamental note and two higher octaves.

There are nine (or sometimes 10, 11 and 12) quadruple strings an either side so that, with 18 groups of strings, 27 different notes can be played. The bass strings are of brass or copper and the trebles of steel.

Persian santoor is played by striking the strings with two light hammers (mezrab) held in three fingers of each hand. The ends of the sticks are usually covered with cloth to soften their impact on the strings.

584653954963833.description:
Live tweets from @newott using the #newottawa hashtag.

We need to reboot the public square and the instruments of government. A compact, efficient city with a well-organized transportation system and a light environmental footprint is cheaper to run and easier to maintain; the very elements that make our cities more sustainable also make them creative, innovative, healthy and prosperous. We need leaders who understand the changing landscape and inspire a shift to a mindset necessary to transition our local governments effectively.

Please join us for a facilitated discussion about what urban planning should look like in a New Ottawa (it's a free event). Your feedback will contribute to our New Ottawa Plan: a shared vision about the future of downtown Ottawa and a practical road map for change.

Date: Saturday, April 26th
Time: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm (coffee/tea served from 11 - 11:15 am)
Location: Ottawa Public Library (Main Branch), 120 Metcalfe Street
Room: B-125 (downstairs, next to the auditorium)
Please RSVP: martin@martincanning.ca (simple as replying to this email)

For more about our campaign or to provide your feedback directly to us please visit www.newottawa.ca.

ADVANCED ACTING FOR THE CAMERA

Do the work on camera!

MONDAYS ~ March 17-April 7, 2014 7pm-10pm (OTTAWA)
WEDNESDAYS ~ March 12-April 2, 2014 7pm-10pm (TORONTO)

Work on scenes from SCREENPLAYS, TV Scripts or PLAYS on-camera — something you’ve written yourself, a brand new assigned scene or SIDES for an upcoming AUDITION.

Practice GOING on ACTION.

MAKE dangerous CHOICES.

HAVE fun in the ROOM.

BRING yourself. Every time.

oh and…

WATCH your WORK. Constructively CRITIQUE yourself.

Each class will commence with RELAXATION and SENSORY, PRIVATE MOMENT and/or ANIMAL EXERCISE.

Locations: 
ACT Studio, 94B Montreal Rd. Ottawa, ON (behind Lorenzo’s Pizza, Palace St. Entrance)

Milestone Casting ~ 401 Logan Ave, Toronto, ON

Space is Limited.

Cost: $222.00 (incl. HST)*

*Discounts for people who are registered in another class in the same session

Registration Deadline: Wednesday, March 5

Instructor: Claudia Jurt

Claudia Jurt is the owner and senior instructor of A.C.T. (Acting for Cinema & Television), a professional acting school that was founded in August 2001. Classes operate in both Ottawa and Toronto. 

Additionally, she is the Ottawa Director and one of the Toronto Directors at Lonsdale Smith Studios.

She continues to work in various aspects of film and television, not only as acting coach, but as director, producer and actor and previously as talent agent and casting director (Ottawa Casting, Ottawa’s original casting company). 

Some of Claudia’s Film & Television credits include, Reign, Clown, Tell the World, Find Me, House at the End of the Street, Metal Tornado, The Righteous Tithe, Une Vie Meilleure, The Maiden Danced to Death, Dark Places, The Wild Hunt, My Family’s Secret, Like Mother, Like Daughter, Maid of Honor, The Cold War Series, Hockey: A People’s History and Naked Josh.

Claudia trained as an actor and teacher with Michèle Lonsdale Smith for close to 10 years in cities
all over the world, including, L.A., New York, London, Vancouver, Toronto, Montreal and Ottawa. A few years ago, She had the honor of working on Fat Pig by Neil LaBute with Michèle at the helm, as director.

She proudly attributes her growth and success to Michèle, her longtime friend and mentor, and is thrilled to be collaborating and teaching under the umbrella of Lonsdale Smith Studios.

In an effort to get back to her roots (she’s originally from Switzerland), Claudia is making a trip to Berlin & Zurich to seek out locations to teach acting intensives. Email us and get on the list!

Also, she is developing a couple of feature film ideas that she intends to write, produce and direct.

Lots to do and so much fun!

Please register online at www.actottawa.com 

actottawa@rogers.com

‘Moon Mothers’ are women who have taken the ‘Moon Mother’ initiation personally from Miranda Gray at a Womb Blessing Training Workshop. This raises them to the high vibrational level required for them to give the transformative Womb Blessing and Womb Healing Attunement in person. The energy works to heal the three main female energy centres; the brow, the heart and the womb and the four female archetypes; the maiden, the mother, the maga and the crone. Think of the ‘Moon Mother initiation’ as a Priestess or Master initiation.

‘Moon Mothers’ are healers, combining the Womb Blessing and Womb Healing with other therapies. They are priestesses and celebrants, helping girls and women through their rites of passage, and they are companions in women’s lives and on their spiritual paths. They can take an active role in spreading the Womb Blessing energy and take part in the worldwide events.

The Womb Blessing is deeply transformational and available to all women.

The Worldwide Womb Blessing events are growing in size. The Blessing in August 2013 had more than 53,000 women in 80 countries. More and more women are wishing to connect and deepen their experience of the 'authentic feminine'.

Moon Mother Louise Hayden, WiseWomanWellWoman, is delighted to be hosting this event in Ottawa with Miranda Gray. 
Louise offers WiseWoman healing sessions, as womb blessing attunements & circles, and teaches regular workshops in Ottawa/Gatineau. She also hosts the Ottawa Red Tent.

Workshops, seminars & mini-conferences for today's direct sellers in a non-partisan, non-company specific, collaborative environment. Social media, networking, H2H (human to human) marketing & why it's all so important.

Leave your recruiting/sponsoring information at HOME!!! We are here to help build your businesses and teams but not at the expense of other consultant's teams.

Booking, selling and sponsoring are the cornerstones to success in every direct selling career. And while society has changed and communication has changed, the way in which direct sellers approach these three tenants of direct selling - really hasn't changed.

Through these events, we will bring in top industry professionals in social media, networking and today's direct sales to help modernize your direct sales business.

Lara Wellman:

Lara helps simplify social media for small business owners. She spent ten years working in public relations and communications for organizations like the University of Ottawa  and the ByWard Market BIA before shifting her skills to helping small business owners take on the new challenges of social media.

She loves helping people understand that social media doesn’t need to be overwhelming or time consuming when you have a plan and the tools in place to keep you on track.

www.wellmanwilsonconsulting.com 

Teresa Scrivens:

Founder of Runway Networking.

Belinda Ellsworth: 

With more than 30 years of experience in direct sales, Belinda has trained thousands of independent sales consultants, managers and executives.  Belinda has worked with more than 100 different direct sales companies, many asking her back again and again.  Why? Simply because she delivers.  Her vast knowledge and expertise in the industry keeps her as one of the most sought after speakers/trainer in the industry.
597456353676582.name: Today's Direct Seller w/Belinda Ellsworth in Ottawa

598568470200191.description:
On June 1, 2014, Cycle for Sight, a fully supported, one-day cycling event, will take you through Ontario's beautiful countryside. Register today and help raise funds for sight-saving research.

Whether you’re a cycling enthusiast or leisure rider, riding a single or tandem bike, Cycle for Sight will be the perfect one-day ride! We offer different distance options, free training and personalized support every step of the way. 

We've got a little something for everyone with two distance options to choose from: 

Manotick Loop - 100 km
Merrickville to Manotick - 50km

If the longer distance option isn't enough of a challenge, then ride it faster. If the shorter option seems insanely challenging, then take your time and enjoy the scenery! You’ll be supported and encouraged from the day you register until you cross the finish line! 

Register today for the perfect one-day ride! Visit www.cycleforsight.ca to learn more and register!
598568470200191.name: Cycle for Sight Ottawa 2014

602963586439235.description:
******
PLEASE NOTE: This event is part of a day-long conference on mental health that all of Body Image Positive's followers are strongly encouraged to participate in. For more info on the broader event, visit the Parlons de la santé mentale 2014/Let's Talk about Mental Health 2014 event page and register. The conference is free of charge to attend and will include refreshments for participants, as well as a ton of engaging workshops on issues related to mental health.
*******

Body Image Positive is thrilled to announce its partnership with the Centre for Students w Disabilities | Centre des Étudiants ayant un Handicap for this special event as part of a day-long conference on the University of Ottawa campus.

Body Talk is a bi-weekly get-together where we aim to have a little social time mixed in with good conversation, focusing on how we see our bodies, how we talk about them, and what might be some shared experiences that have contributed to our personal concepts of body image. This is an informal discussion in a safe space where all are encouraged to share their experiences.

This body talk will have a particular focus on the ideas surrounding how body image can impact our mental health.

The venue will be the Agora on the ground floor of the Jock Turcot University Centre on the University of Ottawa campus. While this event is being organized on campus, non-students are welcome to attend, and are asked to register through the CSD/CEH so that the conference organizers can plan accordingly for food and such.

If you have questions about the venue or conference, including how to get there, please don't hesitate to ask. Contact Lia from Body Image Positive at ottawa@bodyimagepositive.com if you have questions specifically about the Body Talk event, or Norah from the CSD/CEH at csd@sfuo.ca if you need more information about or would like to register for the conference.
602963586439235.name: Body Talk: in partnership with uOttawa's Centre for Students with Disabilities

605973209497993.description:
The Rotary Club of Ottawa Metro is proud to present its first (hopefully) annual scavenger hunt Ottawa... Lost and Found, with the goal of raising money for the Rotary Home Adult Respite Care Program. The Rotary Club of Ottawa Metro is a provisional club and we are hoping that this event will help us gain recognition across the city and create interest in our club for our eventual chartering.  

We look to you, friends, to help spread the word about this wonderful event. Teams of 3-5 adults and children will race across downtown Ottawa with the goal of winning the coveted first prize trophy (and other prizes). Clues will aid participants to deepen their knowledge about this wonderful city. 

The Scavenger Hunt will take place on Saturday May 31, 2014 at 2pm, with registration beginning at 1:30pm, at the First Baptist Church, at the corner of Laurier and Elgin (140 Laurier Avenue West). Cost is $5 per person or $20 per team. Registration can also be done online through PayPal, which will add to our website soon. 

Following the event, participants will be able to enjoy a post-event celebration at D'Arcy McGees at Metcalfe and Sparks, where the prizes will be distributed and food enjoyed. 

See you there!
605973209497993.name: Ottawa Lost... and Found!

606000352823114.description:
Aimez-vous les débats, les discussions allumées et les rencontres avec d'autres personnes passionnées? Voulez-vous partager vos idées afin de faire une différence dans votre communauté? Si oui, venez découvrir l'organisme qui défend les intérêts des étudiant(e)s francophones de l'Ontario lors de l'Assemblée générale annuelle (AGA) du Regroupement étudiant franco-ontarien (RÉFO)!

Pendant deux jours et demi ce printemps, une centaine d'étudiant(e)s des quatre coins de l'Ontario se rassemblent à l'Université Saint-Paul à Ottawa pour le plus important rassemblement étudiant franco-ontarien de l'année!  

En plus de célébrer le 5e anniversaire du RÉFO, l'AGA vous permettra d'en apprendre sur les activités de votre Regroupement, d'influencer le choix des priorités étudiantes qui seront défendues par l'organisme pour l'année à venir et d'élire le conseil d'administration provincial, composé de trois coprésidences et d'un(e) représentant(e) pour chacun des 11 institutions postsecondaires de la francophonie ontarienne. 

Un transport et un hébergement seront organisés pour les participant.e.s venant de l'extérieur d'Ottawa. 

Pour vous inscrire à l'AGA ou pour consulter l'horaire complet de l'activité, visitez le www.refo.ca/aga !

La date limite d'inscription est le 25 avril 2014.
606000352823114.name: 5e Assemblée générale annuelle du RÉFO à Ottawa

"sweet, soulful, smooth and sublime" 
- David Newman (Durga Das)

Jim Gelcer (http://jimgelcerkirtan.com) infuses new life and spirit into the ancient heartfelt chants that influence today's Kirtan movement. With a voice filled with depth and emotion, and impeccable musicianship, he tastefully blends flavours of vintage pop-soul with catchy melodies and the celebratory essence of Kirtan. His new album Bhakti Groove Machine recorded in San Francisco is hot off the press.

Jim is also Music Director for Shri Fest. Check out this montage featuring a track from Bhakti Groove Machine:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c8zmu51ZMic

You can preview and download Jim's music (pay what you want) at:

http://jimgelcer.bandcamp.com

Jim will be accompanied on tabla and viola by Donald Quan, who recorded and toured extensively with Loreena McKennitt and is an accomplished composer for television and film.

610806368996511.description:
It’s your favourite time of year again… Soon the entire Glebe will be abuzz with lawn-hawking like you’ve never seen. It’s this annual mecca of bargain-hunters from near and far that gave birth to Ecology Ottawa’s Great Glebe GREEN Garage Sale!

To help make the Great Glebe GREEN Garage Sale a success, we are actively looking for people who want to donate their unwanted stuff, volunteers of all ages, and folks who want to contribute yummy treats to our bake sale. 

Visit http://ecologyottawa.ca/garage-sale/ to learn more about how you can support this fun and important community event.

ABOUT

Now in its 7th year, the Great Glebe GREEN Garage Sale has become one of Ecology Ottawa’s flagship annual events. What started as a humble fundraiser in 2008 has grown into a massive event that—in addition to the garage sale itself—now features a vegetarian BBQ (join us for lunch), a bake sale (including hot coffee at the crack of dawn), and live musical performances.

We also have massage therapists (to help you relax after a long day of shopping), fun activities for kids of all ages, and much, much more!

Back by popular demand, we will also have a water bottle refilling station on site, as well as portable public washrooms for the community’s use (when nature calls).

The event has raised over $40,000 to date. All items sold at the event are collected from over 200 supporters from across the city, and all proceeds raised go to charity (90% to Ecology Ottawa, 10% to The Ottawa Food Bank). Everything is coordinated by more than 100 passionate volunteers, without whom this event would not be possible.

This event is part of the community-wide Great Glebe Garage Sale that takes place across the neighbourhood, organized by the Glebe Community Association.

For more info, please visit our web site at http://ecologyottawa.ca/garage-sale/.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Votre temps préféré de l’année approche… Bientôt tout le Glebe s’animera au pas des gens venus épier les pelouses comme jamais auparavant. C’est cette mecque annuelle de chasseurs d’aubaines venus d’un peu partout, qui a donné naissance à la Super vente-débarras ÉCOLOGIQUE du Glebe d’Écologie Ottawa!

Pour que la Super vente-débarras ÉCOLOGIQUE du Glebe soit un succès, nous recherchons activement des gens qui peuvent nous donner des articles non désirés, des bénévoles de tout âge et des gens qui contribueront de délicieuses gâteries à notre vente de pâtisseries.

Visitez http://ecologieottawa.ca/more/evenements-annuels/vente-debarras/ pour en savoir plus sur les différentes façons d’appuyer cet événement communautaire important et amusant. 

À PROPOS

Maintenant dans sa 7e année, la Super vente-débarras ÉCOLOGIQUE du Glebe est devenue l'un des événements annuels marquants d'Écologie Ottawa. Ce qui a débuté comme une humble activité de financement en 2008 est devenu un événement majeur, qui, en plus de la vente-débarras même, met maintenant en vedette un BBQ végétarien (venez diner avec nous), une vente de pâtisseries (y compris un café chaud tôt le matin), et des performances musicales.

Nous avons aussi des massothérapeutes (pour vous aider à vous détendre après une longue journée de magasinage), des activités amusantes pour les enfants de tous âges et beaucoup plus encore!

De retour à la demande générale, nous aurons une station de remplissage de bouteille d'eau, ainsi que des toilettes publiques mobiles (pour répondre à l’appel de la nature).

Jusqu’à présent, l’événement a contribué plus de 40 000 $. Tous les articles vendus lors de l’événement sont recueillis auprès de plus de 200 donateurs à travers la ville et tous les fonds amassés iront à la charité (90% à Écologie Ottawa, 10% à la Banque d’alimentation d’Ottawa). Tout est coordonné par plus de 100 bénévoles passionnés, sans qui, cet événement n’aurait pas lieu. 

Cet événement fait partie de la Super vente-débarras du Glebe qui se déroulera à travers le quartier et qui est organisée par l'Association communautaire du Glebe.

Pour de plus amples renseignements, s.v.p. visitez notre site web à : http://ecologieottawa.ca/more/evenements-annuels/vente-debarras/.
610806368996511.location: 680 & 690 Bank Street at Glebe Avenue (in the Rogers Plus and Kunstadt Sports parking lots)  / 680 & 690 rue Bank à l’angle de l’avenue Glebe (dans les stationnements de Rogers Plus et de Kunstadt Sports)
610806368996511.name: Ecology Ottawa's Great Glebe GREEN Garage Sale 2014 / La Super vente-débarras ÉCOLOGIQUE du Glebe d’Écologie Ottawa 2014

615019235245433.description:
This group is a FREE community group open to moms and dads looking to receive or give positive information about birth and an opportunity to connect with and gain support from other like-minded parents. 

We meet on the fourth Wednesday of the month at 7pm at Marketplace Family Chiropractic Centre, 80 Marketplace Avenue, Unit J2 Barrhaven. 

Future meeting dates:  April 30th (5th Wednesday), May 28th, June 25th, July 23rd, August 27th, September 24th, October 22nd, November 26th.

To be notified of upcoming meetings you can enter your address on this page:  http://yourbirthcoach.com/join-the-community/positive-birth-movement/

"Women have been successfully birthing babies since the beginning of time and I believe YOU can do it to. I have had three incredibly wonderful natural home birth experiences in 2006, 2009, and 2011. I have supported many women through pregnancy and birth. I have seen how information, support, and belief in yourself, your baby, and birth can transform women, families, and lives forever."

“For me an empowered birth is one where I am the one who makes the decisions for me and my baby. Where I am in an environment of love, support, and respect for the power within my body to successfully birth my baby. Where I can be free to express anything I need to express; sound, movement, fear, love, ecstasy in a place that my expression will not lead to interference from the outside. I believe women have the ability to create an empowering birth experience regardless of if the birth outcome is natural, medicated, or surgical. When women are making the decisions for their bodies and their babies out of education, faith, belief and confidence in themselves and not out of fear or manipulation they will be empowered. I believe in the human body, in it’s power, and in birth’s ability to transform a person, woman, wife, and mother.” 

For more info see: 
http://yourbirthcoach.com
http://naturalbirthbabyandbeyond.com
http://facebook.com/yourbirthcoachdrnancy


or contact Nancy via:
info@yourbirthcoach.com
613-823-1255

Topics previously discussed:
'Positive Birth Is...'
'Prenatal Testing'
'Oxytocin'
'Improving Birth'
 'Risk'
 'Fear'
 'The Hour After Birth'
 'Choices in Birth'
 'Birth Place'
 'Language of Birth'
'Images of Birth'
615019235245433.name: Positive Birth Ottawa

Walking from Victoria to Ottawa Leaving Friday morning from Mile 0 walking along Pat Bay to Ferry.
i will be walking and praying and smudging along the way. I have 3 bundles of sage to start and 3 sweetgrass braid and some tobacco. But will need more. I hope many of friends will share this with their friends and I will be able to meet many people along the way. 
I have a chequing account #3008-587 transit#32589 institution#001 at B ank of Montreal. my DOB October 1st 1972 my address is 4491 Abraham Crt, Victoria. 
I will be walking along Hwy 17 to Hwy 1 then straight across. Thanks to John Entropp I have a cell phone now. I can receive text but no incoming calls yet. (250)220 0823. Though it says I am leaving at 7AM, I will there at Mile 0 at 7 AM then off to ferry along 17 after prayer and song. 
Hope to see you there.
Email money transfer can be made to rhay39@gmail.com 
The security question answer should be James. and i will be able to receive any and all monetary help. Chi Miigwetch  

Once i reach the mainland I will heading toward port Coquitam Heading towards Maple Ridge through to Mission staying on the #7 Hwy till it turns into Hwy 1 again. I will stay on Hwy 1 to Cache creek and the follow Hwy 1 through Kamloops Chase Salmon Arm Revelstoke and Golden. My time is get there when i arrive/ lol. This is my B.C route. Banking information has been included on event info for anyone who may want to help out. I look forward to this big adventure, To the stories I will hear and share my story as well. It is my hope and belief that this walk will bring some healing on many levels to many things. Once I reach Alberta I will update travel info. Much love to you all. 

This walk is done to honour our grandmothers grandfathers brothers sister and anyone affected by the residential School atrocity. It is about the reconcilliation that Corprate greed needs to show tp the Environment and us as Human beings for the wealth Health it is stealing from us! It is about the Cancer Survivor's, and fighters. It is about all the Brothers and Sister who go fight in Wars that don't concern us and are left with wouds far deeper than bullets get, and the government that has abandoned. It is about healing wounds through prayer and connection. 

For me it is about Love.

616300488446389.description:
Have fun staying fit and supporting the health of friends and loved ones in the community! (And beating the amount fundraised by other uOttawa and Carleton teams!)

Sign up your uOttawa team of friends for Lap the Gats, a charitable 21 km bike ride through Gatineau Park in support of Parkinson's disease research. 

Teams can competitive - the Fastest Solo, Team, or Relay Team biker will be awarded, or casual -  all Lap the Gats participants will enjoy the scenic ride through Gatineau Park! Every participant is asked to raise $100 for Parkinson's research. Beat the funds raised by other teams and win some prizes!


Check out the official Lap the Gats Facebook page and http://lapthegats.org/ for more information. See you there!

To join our team, register under Team uOttawa Parkinson Community. The password is LaptheGats

Participants can earn district level  ranking points - go to the Junior Rankings section to learn more.  There are also trophies and medals for the winners.  Free t-shirts are available for the first 150 registrants. And, for those that will be trying out for the OWG team should seriously consider participating in this tournament.

Led by Shanna Bernier, Joelle Leduc & Jean-Daniel Williams . Each community is invited to send at least one Youth or Young Adult delegate to have a voice in the decision making of our church. In addition to fully participating in the meeting the YAYA Program begins a day early, so that the YAYA can form theirown community. 625675540814594.description:
Hey Dodgeballers!

We are introducing a brand new dodgeball tournament concept that has never been done in Ottawa but has been a huge success in Toronto.

The Canadian Dodgeball Association is sending a Men’s and Women’s team to Hong Kong to compete in the World Dodgeball Invitational in June. Both teams won gold last year and our national team is looking to keep the title! We are trying to raise as much money as possible to help the players with some of their costs associated with this tournament.

TO REGISTER:
Visit http://www.dodgeballottawa.com/tournaments.html to make payment to reserve your spot. You will also need to specify your skill level and the name of the person you want to play with (if applicable) in the "Notes".

HOW IT WORKS:
- Players sign up INDIVIDUALLY, providing only their name and skill level.
- The tournament committee creates balanced teams a week before the event. Each team is guaranteed to have some advanced players, some intermediate players, and some beginner players … so there will be no elite teams which crush everyone because that’s not fun for most people!
- Players can request to play with one other person and the committee will do their best to satisfy all requests…as long as the teams can remain balanced.
- The best part about this is that you get to play with different people and ANY team can win the whole thing!

OTHER INFORMATION:
- Entry fee: $25 per person
- Format: 6 foam balls (4 small, 2 big). Rules to be provided prior to event.
- Battle of the Courts (optional): $5 entry, last person standing takes half the pot!
- Skills Competitions (optional): $5 entry, details below.
- Prizes: Winners of the tournament and skills competitions will receive prizes ... size to be determined based on number of participants

SKILLS COMPETITIONS ($5 gives you entry to all 5 events):
* Fastest throw: Throw 5 balls - highest average speed wins
* Most accurate throw: Hit 5 different targets - most targets hit wins
* Fastest rush: Explode to the centreline to pick up a ball, bring it back to the clear line and throw it - fastest time wins
* Best survival: Catch, block, and dodge to survive as long as possible - best time wins
* Guess your speed: Throw 2 balls and we will tell you the speed, then guess the speed of your 3rd throw - closest guess wins

-------------------------------
SKILL LEVEL DEFINITIONS:

Beginner: Have never played or play at the Recreational level (OSSC or other leagues).

Intermediate: Play at the Intermediate level (OSSC or other leagues) and understand the flow of the game and the rules. Skillful in at least one of these categories; throwing, catching, blocking/dodging.

Advanced: Play at the Intermediate/Advanced level (OSSC or other leagues) with success. Understand the intricacies of the sport, used to tournaments and proficiently skilled in multiple categories; throwing, catching, blocking/dodging.
-------------------------------

Please don't hesitate to ask us if you have any questions. Please help spread the word and invite your friends! As all teams will be balanced, this is sure to be a fun and exciting event for participants of all skill levels!

Thanks in advance for your support!
