629430320464698.description:
OTTAWA STAND UP! #BringBackOurGirls 

Two weeks ago, 234 girls between the ages of 16 and 18 were abducted by Boko Haram terrorists from the Chibok Government Secondary School in Borno State, Nigeria. Recent information has updated the number to 276 girls missing. 

Nigerians all over the world have rallied to help raise awareness of this issue and to also criticize the minimal efforts the Nigerian government has been making to help find the girls and stop the violence in Nigeria.

The Nigerian community in Ottawa has decided to play our part with one of these rallies. We will be having a march of solidarity for the girls and for other issues going on in the country on Sunday May 4th, 2014 at 6 pm. 

The Rally/March will kick off at the Nigerian Embassy in Ottawa (295 Metcalfe St, Ottawa) and we will march down to the human rights monument which is opposite City Hall (110 Laurier Ave W, Ottawa). 
There, we will light our candles and say a prayer for the girls and for the country as a whole. After that, we will march down to Rideau Center and those who wish can pass out flyers and inform the public about the missing girls.(Anyone can take part in handing out flyers, no one is obligated to do it)

Please come out and support. Help spread the word and create awareness. It could be anyone of us. Let our voices be heard. 
May God bless you as you take part.

WEAR RED and those who are able should wear a head tie. #BringBackOurGirls #BringBackOurGirlsCanada #Ottawa #BringBackOurGirlsAlive

Thank you and see you Sunday!
629430320464698.name: BringBackOurGirlsOttawa

632511590129528.description:
GET YOUR FILM SCENE!

Where: IFCO's Members Lounge - Ste #140 - #2 Daly Avenue, Arts Court Building
When: Monday, April 7th, 2014
Time: 6:30pm to 9:30pm
Cost: Full member $100.00, Basic member $110.00, Student* $135.00, Non-Student* $160.00
(* Non-member rates include an IFCO membership)
Instructor: Alexander Carson
Registration Deadline: Monday, March 31st, 2014

So you’ve finished your film, and you want to get it seen. This workshop will provide novice and emerging filmmakers with the basics on how to submit your film to film festivals, and navigate the film and arts festival circuits. Film Festivals are a great vehicle for independent filmmakers to get their film out into the film scene. So if you don’t want your film to sit on a shelf, and you want to get people talking about you and your film, then this workshop is a MUST!

Instructor's Bio:
Alexander Carson is Canadian filmmaker and a founding member of the North Country Cinema media arts collective. He holds a BFA and an MA from the Mel Hoppenheim School of Cinema at Concordia University in Montréal, and his films have won awards and recognition at major festivals across Canada, the United States, and Europe.

Enrolment for this class is limited, and will be on a first come, first serve basis. If you'd like more information, or would like to register for the workshop, please contact our Membership Coordinator at (613) 569 –1789 or via e-mail at admin@ifco.ca.

635213569865045.description:
Sunday May 4th will see the Quebec Saints in their first big hit out of the year when they face both Team Canada and Ottawa Swans in a carnival day of 18 a side footy at the Rideau Carleton Raceway Oval in Ottawa.
 
No matter at what stage you are at in your Australian Rules football career, whether you will be a first game rookie or a 15 year veteran you will be guaranteed ample game time on the day. This will also be the first chance for everybody to stretch their legs after a long Montreal winter and show off their newly learned/refined skills from indoor practice.

First game will see the AFL Quebec representative team the Quebec Saints face off against the might of Team Canada at 11pm (Please note the time Change) who will be three months out on their assault at World Domination at the 2014 International Cup.

The Quebec Saints will then renew their rivalry with the Ottawa Swans in the second game of the day at 12.30pm in the Pony Platter Shield.

We ask all players to be at the field no later then 10.00am.

More details to follow

......................

Dimanche, le 4 mai, verra les Saints de Québec disputer leur première partie 18 contre 18 en plus de 3 ans! Pendant cette journée mémorable ils affronteront la sélection nationale du Canada en plus des Swans d'Ottawa au terrain du Rideau Carleton Raceway à Ottawa.

Peu importe votre expérience au niveau du football Australien, que ce soit votre premier match ou votre 250e, vous êtes garantie de vous retrouver sur le terrain de jeu pour une bonne partie de la journée. Ce sera aussi la première occasion pour tous de jouer à l'extérieur après un long hiver et de montrer nos nouveaux talents qu'on a appris lors des pratiques intérieures.

La première partie opposera l'équipe de Saints à la selection Canadienne à 11h00. Ces dernier se préparent pour la domination mondiale au International Cup 2014 qui se tiendra en août, à Melbourne en Australie.

Ensuite les Saints de Québec renoueront leur rivalité avec les Swans d'Ottawa dans leur deuxième partie de la journée qui devrait débuter aux alentours de 12h30.

Plus de détails suivront.

635911266485803.description:
Come join us at The Daily Grind on Saturday, May 3rd for our last official show in Ottawa. We're moving on to the bright lights of Toronto this summer, but we wanted to bid a fond farewell to the capital city and all the quality folks who have been so kind along the way. 

As an added bonus, we are thrilled to be kicking the night off with the old soul sounds of Allie Fox and The Ivory Tower, all the way from Potsdam, New York.

So round up some homies on May 3rd and mosey on down to the Daily Grind. We'll drink some drinks, play some songs, and try not to get too nostalgic. 

$7 at the door. Doors at 9:30pm.

639952839393565.description:
http://www.preface2014.com
(l'Anglais suit/Engish Follows)

Préface est une exposition qui présente les œuvres des étudiants finissants du programme de Baccalauréat en arts visuels (B.A.V.) 2014. Au sens littéraire, la préface sert non seulement de propos introductif, mais aussi à définir le but et l’intention de ce qui va suivre. Dans le contexte de cette classe de finissants, l’exposition sert d’introduction au travail de 40 artistes émergents et marque le début de leur carrière artistique.
 
L’exposition, qui regroupe une si grande variété d’artistes, reflète la diversité inhérente du groupe et comprend des œuvres relevant de diverses disciplines : dessin, peinture, sculpture, photographie, multimédia, installation et performance. Chaque artiste présente des œuvres créées au cours de la dernière année du programme, fruit de quatre années de croissance et d’épanouissement, d’exploration et d’expérimentation.
 
Dates et heures de l’exposition: du mardi 22 avril au samedi 26 avril – de 8 h à 18 h.

Vernissage: le vendredi 25 avril 2014, 19h - 22h

Soirée portes ouvertes « Rencontrez l’artiste »: le mardi 22 avril – de 15 h à 19 h.
---
 
Preface is an exhibition which showcases work from the graduating class of 2014, from the University of Ottawa’s Bachelor of Fine Arts (BFA) program. In literary terms, a preface not only acts as a preliminary statement, but also sets a purpose or intention for what is to follow. Within the context of this graduating class, the exhibition acts as an introduction to the work of 40 emerging artists, and the beginning of their artistic careers.
 
Consisting of work created by so many different artists, the exhibition inherently reflects the diversity present within the group, comprised of works within the fields of drawing, painting, sculpture, photography, multimedia, installation, and performance. Each artist presents work created within the final year in the program, the refined result of four years of growth and development, exploration and experimentation.
 
Exhibition Dates/Hours: Tuesday, April 22nd to Saturday, April 26th, 8 a.m. – 6 p.m.

Vernissage: Friday, April 25th, 2014, 7-10 p.m.

“Meet-the-Artist” Open House: Tuesday, April 22nd, 3 – 7 p.m.
639952839393565.name: Preface/Préface 2014

651624821552301.description:
Burlesque Idol is back, and this time the winner receives the grand prize of a spot performing in the  prestigious Ottawa Burlesque Festival!!

Did you have your first burlesque performance on or after April 1 2012? Are you still waiting to debut and feel like taking a chance on Burlesque Idol? Apply now!!

We are looking for fun and interesting burlesque and variety performances from new and aspiring performers of all genders, abilities, body types, and performance styles. 

Successful applicants will be scored from 1-5 on the following categories, for a total score out of 20.

ORIGINALITY (how original is your concept/music/costume, or how original is your execution of a familiar concept/music/costume)
STAGE PRESENCE (Do you exude confidence? Is it impossible for us to take our eyes off of you?)
"TITS UP" (this means hair and makeup, and yes this is important for boys, too!)
COSTUME (your costume does not have to be expensive, but we want to see that you put thought into it)

All applicants must be 19 years of age or older by April 12, 2014

We ask a $5 application fee to be considered as a contestant in Burlesque Idol

Register your application here by April 4, 2014: http://ottawaburlesquefestival.wordpress.com/news/

Successful applicants will be notified via email on April 7.


In 2010, Rockalily Burlesque held Ottawa's first Burlesque Idol competition to benefit breast cancer research charities, and showcase new burlesque talent in Ottawa. 

There was too much talent in Burlesque Idol 2010 for one competition to contain! Contestants went on to perform as independent artists, as members of Browncoats Burlesque, and Rockalily Burlesque, and to become founding members of Ottawa Burlesque Playground and Ottawa Burlesque Festival.


Burlesque Idol 2014 is hosted by Helvetica Bold and Headmistress Holly Sin, with Rhapsody Blue as the house marm/stage manager.


$10 advance tickets available online here: http://burlesqueidol2014.eventbrite.ca

$15 at the door


All of the proceeds from Burlesque Idol will go towards funding the Ottawa Burlesque Festival.

Your burlesque idol judges will be:

Co-founder of Ottawa Burlesque Playground and acclaimed cabaret singer, Meena Jatrois

One half of the international Wanderlust Burlesque Tour 2013, Jolie Stripes: Ottawa's Very Own French Kiss 

Founder of Bourbon and Spice Burlesque, Kerosene Misfortune 

Bollywood/Bellydance fusion and burlesque artist at Browncoats Burlesque, Kamie Lyann 

The woman behind the most beautiful cupcakes at every burlesque bake sale, and co-producer of Theatre Carnaval, Charlotte Champagne 

The bionic co-founder of Ottawa Burlesque Playground, Lila Livewire 

Mr. Alexander Mansfield, choreographer and 1/3 of the fine and dandy Mansfield Brothers Vaudeville Troupe

Cakes, Wings & Other Things…
Saturday May 17, 2014
8am-1pm
Ottawa Executive Airport, Zeeland
5923 Byron Road, Zeeland

Please Join us for our third annual family friendly community event. This year  we have partnered with Bluebird Cancer Retreats of West Michigan and the Shields of Hope.  All the money raised at the event will go directly to Bluebird Cancer Retreats.  Bluebird Cancer Retreats offer a unique experience of weekend programs, that provides hope and renewal for adults who have been diagnosed with cancer. Bluebird’s retreats are held on the shores of Lake Michigan at the beautiful Geneva Camp & Retreat Center. Attendees are given time to reflect, share, and learn about coping with cancer while participating in a variety of educational and social activities.  Participants enjoy a pampering weekend with wonderful food, fun entertainment, holistic treatments such as massage and reflexology and so much more.

Please Check Bluebird Cancer Retreats web page to learn more and opportunities to help
http://www.bluebirdmi.org/pg/Home/

We have all been affected by cancer. Maybe not directly but definitely someone we know has been diagnosed…whether it’s a family member, friend, co-worker, or someone else in your life, you know someone. And if you don’t, you are truly blessed! 

Come join us for: 

*	Pancake breakfast, including beverages, pancakes and breakfast meats. By donation.
*	Silent auction, featuring several gift cards, overnight stays, kid’s activities and gift baskets from local businesses. Winners will be announced at 12:30pNm.
*	Children’s activities including face painting, games and bouncy house 
*	Several airplanes will be available for scenic tours of the West Michigan Lakeshore. 
*	In addition, the Zeeland Fire Department, Ottawa County Marine Water Rescue boat, and an Ambulance will be on display
* War Birds will be doing a fly over once again this year see the cover photo of this even for a picture from last year (You don't want to miss this, so cool to see!!)

New this Year we will be able to accept Visa and Mastercard

662157270515723.description:
You research or write about immigration, work with newcomers or public policy gets you going. Or maybe you just love to code for fun, and want to put your skills to use on a new topic. Grab a friend and join us for Datafest Ottawa: Hacking Migration in the Capital on April 12 & 13.

What’s it all about?

•	Datafest Ottawa is a two-day creative, collaborative blitz. We’re bringing diverse expertise together to brainstorm ways for technology to shed light on challenges in migration, whether it’s practical tools for new arrivals or data-related research questions.
•	This hackathon is all about laying the groundwork for an exciting cross-sector conversation in Ottawa. You’ll work on a team in Adobe Canada’s beautiful Klondike Room in the heart of Little Italy, where you’ll make new connections and vie to be among the best projects. 
•	We’ll start at 9 a.m. Saturday with a brief introduction and overview of what’s to come. Then it’s Pitch Time, when anyone with an idea they’d like to work on has 3 minutes to make their pitch. Then we’ll form teams of coders, subject experts and data curators and set to work developing the best ideas into data visualizations, app concepts, web site prototypes – whatever your combined creativity and skills can dream up in just two days.
•	Thanks to sponsors Adobe and Pythian, there will be delicious snacks and great meals to keep you fuelled up.
•	We’ll adjourn for the evening and reconvene at 9 a.m. Sunday. Early Sunday afternoon, each team will present its project and a panel of judges will decide on the top 3.
662157270515723.name: Datafest Ottawa - Hacking Migration in the Capital

663930773671514.description:
Ottawa Launch Party for the Peoples Social Forum - Arts Edition.

Tuesday April 8th at G101 & ICMI 
51 B Young Street (Corner of Young & Champagne)

7pm: Potluck (please list ingredients), mingle, connect with social forum organizers, register for the forum
7:30pm-11:00pm: poetry, short speeches, musical performances, & dancing

The theme of this first social event is ARTS & CULTURE.  In that spirit we encourage you all to invite the artists in your lives to come participate and get involved as Art is a crucial component of the forum.   

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

This summer,  Ottawa will host a historic convergence of social movements and progressive minds, the scale and scope of which has never been seen in Canada.  Activists, Students, Indigenous peoples, Unions, Youth, Environmentalists, and thousands of ordinary fed-up individuals from across this land will gather to oppose the current political and economic order and propose a plurality of alternative paths towards a better world.  As Ottawa organizers and activists we are working to bring our talents, struggles, campaigns, and movements to the forefront of this event and to welcome the thousands of people who will come to participate with us in launching the first-ever: “People's Social Forum”.

Join us, here in the host community, to celebrate the ongoing efforts to build this historic event, hear from local activists and movement leaders, connect with people active in the organizing process, register for the forum, share your visions and ideas for forum activities, get plugged into the local organizing groups, eat, drink and be merry. 

Featured Performances

7:30 – Elizabeth Riley Band

8:00 – Poets Brandon Wint and Brad Morden

8:30 – Eric Mandala

9:15 – Slim Moore and the New Soul Project

Additional Performances by Hip-hop artist Testament of the group "Test Their Logik" and Laura Margita

**Please support the artists who support our movements! 
___

Social Forums are spaces for activists, grassroots groups, scholars, and civil society organizations to come together to share knowledge and experience on social justice issues and organizing.

The first Social Forum was held in Porto Alegre, Brazil in 2001 and has since spread around the world as a means for progressive movements and people to connect, develop relationships, build solidarity, and strengthen campaigns and struggles for social, political, and economic change. 

www.peoplessocialforum.org
663930773671514.name: Ottawa Launch Party for the People's Social Forum - Arts edition

666489786719581.description:
PTS in collaboration with the Sexual Assault Support Centre of Ottawa(Sasc Ottawa) are asking for trans women and transfeminine community members to participate as planning partners for an eight week series regarding transmisogyny in GLBTTQ (inclusive) spaces as well as social service organizations. No formal planning or organizational experience is required -- only a willingness to share your views and experiences and to work together with others! Confidentiality within the group will be respected.

The current plan: 
The eight week series, which we hope to begin around mid-May, is to be guided by the recommendations made from the planning partners who wish to lend their knowledge, opinions, advice, experience and expertise on the structure of the series, information and activities presented. Planning partners are strongly encouraged to take the lead on facilitating the series with the support of PTS and SASC volunteers and staff. 

The second planning meeting will take place at PTS on Wednesday, May 14 @ 6pm

You can RSVP by email to programs@ptsottawa.org or calling 613-563-4818 - you do not need to RSVP to this event page to attend. 

**Accessibility Note: the PTS centre is accessible for folks with wheelchairs and walkers. The building also has an elevator. The front door of the building does not have an automatic button and the washrooms are not wheelchair accessible.**

Runners from 84 countries have started running their own version of  The Boston Marathon  in the Boston Marathon World Run!  

You can participate in this virtual run right here in Ottawa and come meet others who have joined the “Boston we run with you – Ottawa” team.

We invite you to come join us on Sunday April 6, anytime between 10 a.m. and noon at Simply Biscotti on Preston St.

Pop in for a hot beverage and a tasty treat, meet others who have signed up and enter to win one of the participation prizes.

There are three ways to get entered in the drawing for one of the participation prizes:
1.	Print out your Boston Marathon World Run bib and bring it with you to show us.
2.	Make a donation (any amount) to the One Fund  when you drop in to see us.
3.	Buy one of the few remaining “Boston we run with you” shirts (proceeds to the The One Fund Boston.

Details on how to participate in the virtual run can be found below:

Sign up, pledge your distance and join the "Boston, we run with you - Ottawa" team, 
http://www.bostonmarathonworldrun.org/ .  Don’t forget to check out the world map, see the photos coming in from around the world.  Registration is free, and you'll receive digital training and finisher badges as part of the program, as well as a bib number and finisher certificate.

You can run or walk your pledged distance anytime before Marathon Monday, April 21, 2014. 

The theme is any distance, any pace, anywhere, so don’t be shy.

681919235199398.description:
2014 is an election year in Ottawa! 

We want to use International Anti-Street Harassment Week as an opportunity to let candidates know that come election time, we'll only be casting a vote for folks who care about ending gender-based violence in our city. 

Join us on Thursday, April 3rd from 6:30-8:30pm at Michele Heights Community Centre (2955 Michele Drive in the city's West End) for an informal gathering. We'll facilitate a short brainstorming session and have tons of creative ways for people to get their voices out there. If you're more crafty than chatty (or vice versa), we got you covered!  And of course, we'll have some snacks, too.

Come for the snacks, stay for the revolution! 

The official goal of this event is to bring together our allies to develop concrete messaging around gender-based violence for 2014 municipal candidates. We're going to aggregate the messages from the event onto our website where we'll have a little hub that basically boils down to: "You want my vote? This is what I expect of you!" 

Our unofficial goal is to bring together like-minded folks in a chill, welcoming space to talk about the reality of street harassment and what we, as a community, want to see done about it. 

Let's make gender-based violence a priority in this city!

Want more info? ottawa@ihollaback.org

NOTE: 
The space is accessible.

This is a SAFE space. If you don't think gender-based violence is a 'thing' or you're a giant jerk, stay home.

This is an event designed for community members. If you're a candidate, GREAT that you want to know what people are thinking! BUT! We'll be aggregating all the feedback  for folks like you to check out at a later date. So, we ask that you stay home, too and allow residents a safe space to chat among themselves.
681919235199398.name: Our City, Our Space, Our Voice: International Anti-Street Harassment Week in Ottawa

685486958164060.description:
Poverty Makes Us Sick and the Ottawa Raise the Rates Committee are excited to welcome Ellen Clifford of Disabled People Against the Cuts (DPAC) to Ottawa as a part of provincial speaking tour, hosted by The Raise the Rates Campaign.

Wednesday, May 7th, 6:30pm
Somerset West Community Health
(55 Eccles Street)

Who is DPAC: The Cameron Government in the UK has implemented brutal cuts to programs for unemployed and disabled people. This includes a system called the Work Capability Assessment that has been used to deny benefits to thousands of people. Disabled People Against Cuts (DPAC) is an organization in the UK that has been at the forefront of challenging this situation. It has mobilized disabled people to fight back and formed alliances with community organizations and unions in resisting the austerity measures of the Cameron Government. The hated private company, Atos, that was carrying out the assessments of sick and disabled people has been forced to quit as a result of the powerful resistance DPAC and others have taken up.

Here in Ontario, we also face major attacks. Ontario Works (Welfare) and ODSP (Disability) rates are too low to enable people to pay their rent and eat properly. The Special Diet and Community Start Up have been slashed by the Ontario Liberal government. Under huge pressure from ongoing community action, the Liberals have promised not to merge OW and ODSP but the danger remains that they will bring in a UK style assessment system that would pose a huge threat to disabled people on ODSP. We need to understand what is happening elsewhere and how people are fighting back and winning against the attacks. Austerity is global – but so is our resistance.

From May 4-15th, Ellen Clifford from DPAC will be visiting Toronto, Kitchener, Sudbury, Kingston and Ottawa. She has been campaigning with the disabled people’s movement for 15 years and, since 2011, has sat on the National Steering Committee of DPAC. She is also a member of Unite the Union and works to build solidarity between workers in unions and those forced to live on social benefits.

----------
Join the Raise the Rates Campaign Today!
Raise the Rates is a campaign to fight poverty by raising social assistance rates in Ontario. Jointly organized by the Ontario Coalition Against Poverty (OCAP), the Canadian Union of Public Employees (CUPE) Ontario, Sudbury Coalition Against Poverty (S-CAP), Kingston Coalition Against Poverty (K-CAP), Poverty Makes Us Sick Waterloo Region, Poverty Makes Us Sick Ottawa, OPSEU and other grassroots anti-poverty organizers and trade union allies from across Ontario. We are a growing movement united in fighting for:

• Raise Social Assistance Rates 55%: reverse the cuts, raise the rates!
• Restore Special Diet and Community Start-Up Benefits
• Stop the Attack on Disability Benefits
• Living wage for all: Raise the Minimum wage above poverty wages
685486958164060.name: Disabled People Against the Cuts Speaking Tour - Ottawa event

691115700931160.description:
Ottawa's second WordCamp! It's two days of "all-you-can-learn" about WordPress!

REGISTER FOR WORDCAMP OTTAWA 2014 AT: http://bit.ly/O23Ua5. (RSVPing on Facebook will NOT register you for the event).

WordCamp Ottawa 2014 will feature up to 27 sessions in 3 tracks, over 2 days. (you can sit in on any session(s) in any track(s) you wish, even hopping between tracks, there are no restrictions as to which sessions you attend)

---------------------------------------------------------------------
Event Schedule: http://bit.ly/1tBYbbq

Optional Pre-camp
Thursday, May 1, 7:00 p.m. to 9:30 p.m., Introduction to WordPress for those who are new to WordPress.
https://www.facebook.com/events/823349141012618/

WordCamp Weekend
Saturday, May 3, 8:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., featuring 45-minute sessions in three tracks. Saturday will include lunch.

Sunday, May 4, 12:00 p.m. to 4:30 p.m., featuring 1-hour-and-45-minute sessions in three tracks
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

What to Expect

“Content Creators” with presentations that will help users that create content in WordPress sites.

“Site Creators” with content for those who are more experienced users, but not necessarily designers or developers.

“Code Creators” will include presentations for designers or developers about site set-up, theme design, plugin development, best practices for development, and more.

Add in the “Happiness Bar” where you can get one on one help with your WordPress questions, and all together we’ll have about 30 talented people, many from our own WordPress community, and others from as far away as Vancouver, presenting to you the latest and greatest for WordPress.

The Sunday sessions are longer to allow presenters time to dive into more involved or advanced topics.  We also hope to have some hands-on workshops.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Speakers, sessions, and other details on our website: http://2014.ottawa.wordcamp.org/

Don’t miss this great event! Register now!

WordCamps are casual, locally-organized conferences focusing on everything related to WordPress. Each WordCamp is a little different, but they all share a similar goal: provide an opportunity for people to come together and discuss their common interest in WordPress, learn from each other, network, and have a great time doing it.
691115700931160.name: WordCamp Ottawa 2014

In collaboration with the Aesculapian Society and CHEO buddies, the Smiling Over Sickness committee would like to invite you to SHAVE FOR A CURE on April 9th 2014 from 16h30 to 20h30 in the Atrium of the Roger Guindon Hall (451 Smyth Road).
 
Please come join the fun and bring hope and a smile to a child's face by participating in Smiling Over Sickness' 11th annual Shave For A Cure! Become a part of this medical-student organized event for games, silent auctions, coffeehouse performances, and of course, HEADSHAVING and HAIR CUTTING as brave students, professors, and community members go bald to raise funds Childhood Cancer Canada! This year we have SEVEN beautiful ladies shaving their head and 30 participants cutting or shaving their hair; you DO NOT want to miss out on the fun!!

Furthermore, this year, we are proud to welcome the inspirational MAX KEEPING at our event! He will be giving a short speech on his involvement in raising awareness with cancer and why it's important for him. We are also pleased to announce that Ottawa's favourite radio station, The New HOT 89.9 FM, will be emceeing our event!

Please note that through their partnership with Childhood Cancer Canada, proceeds from St. Baldrick's head-shaving events throughout Canada are distributed to Canadian institutions through the C17 Research Network. Hence, FUNDS RAISED IN CANADA STAY IN CANADA! The C17 Research Network also receives funds through an annual St. Baldrick's grant to the Children's Oncology Group (COG).

Propelled by inspired fiddle playing, warm vocals, and arresting original songs, Laura Cortese has emerged as one of the most intriguing, versatile, and refreshing musicians in the bountiful New England post-folk scene. There is nothing timid about Laura Cortese (cor-TAY-zee). She wields a fiddle like a rocker slings his guitar, and sings with even more swagger. A native San Franciscan, Cortese moved to Boston to study violin at Berklee College of Music and has since immersed herself in the city's vibrant folk music scene. She has made appearances with Band of Horses, Pete Seeger, Patterson Hood and Michael Franti, and Jocie Adams of the Low Anthem. Laura tours internationally with Mariel Vandersteel.

Mariel Vandersteel grew up in the redwoods of California playing for local contra dances, at Irish sessions and spending summers at fiddle camp. Her love and curiosity for other musical cultures led her to study music nationally as well as in Ireland and at a hardanger fiddle school in Norway. A graduate of Berklee College of Music, Mariel has participated in the Savannah Music Festival's Acoustic Music Seminar studying under musicians including Mike Marshall, Edgar Meyer, Chris Thile and Zakir Hussein.
 
www.lauracortese.net
 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L-upN4K2lJY – pretty much what you’re going to hear
 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VrsxQkwsujU – again, a great representation of these gals
 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SME4HO0dP8I – official video

738765966157219.description:
Blues Hall of Fame Inductee and Living Legend Lazy Lester comes back to Canada for 3 dates only and Ottawa is one of them. Lazy Lester, one of the original bluesmen, still active. Back in 1956, halfway between Louisiana’s blues capital, Baton Rouge and Lake Charles, in a small studio outside of Crowley, La., producer Jay Miller created a unique, legendary sound for EXCELLO records, swamp blues. It would emerge from the bayous, the rice fields, and the stable of blues talent Miller had assembled. They created some of the most memorable American music ever recorded.  Lazy Lester was at its heart. Slim Harpo, Raful Neal, Lightin`Slim, Lonesome Sundown, Katie Webster and Leslie Johnston, better known by the nickname Miller gave him, Lazy Lester. He was the mainstay of the EXCELLO sound as he played all the instruments and sat in everywhere, the man who could back anything. Songs from the studio included Harpo`s “King Bee”, “Rainin’ in my Heart”, “Baby Scratch My Back”, Hogan’s “Everybody Needs Somebody”, Arthur Gunter’s “Baby Lets Play House”, Slim’s, “Bad Luck Blues”-“if it wasn’t for bad luck, I wouldn’t have no luck at all”, his, “Crazy ‘Bout You Baby”, “The Things I Used to Do”. Besides playing on some of the above, to this mix Lester added his own swamp blues classics, like: “I’m a Lover Not a Fighter”   “I hear You Knockin" “Sugar Coated Love”  and  “I Done Got Over it”.

Most of these performers are gone but there is Lester, 55 years later and he still has his chops. He is carrying on a tradition for lots of people who have passed. Lester, now 81, still performs with gusto and precision. His nasal pitched voice, imitated by his harp and his tight playing and arrangements still give the music a homemade feel. His biggest influences are two of the greatest bluesmen, Jimmy Reed and Little Walter, one on his vocals and the other, his harp playing. Lester mixes this sound with dashes of the country music he grew up with all around him, the real kind, traditional Cajun or Jimmie Rodgers influenced country. “The music has a lazy, loping feel, rhythmic edge, bathed in simmering, pulsating tape echo” says AllMusic. Lester, fed up with the music business, dropped out of it for twenty years. After his break he emerged and fashioned a long acclaimed revival.  Lester was a W.C. Handy Award winner in 1987 for “Lazy Lester Rides Again” recorded in England. He followed in the U.S., with his 1988 album, “Harp & Soul”, music with a sound redolent of all those Louisiana Swamp Blues Classics but with an updated edge that works well. He is a member of The BLUES HALL OF FAME in Memphis.  His song “Pondarosa Stomp” gave its name to the roots festival that runs during the N.O. Jazz and Heritage Festival, The Ponderosa Stomp.  This is a chance to see one of the great pioneers of the blues, take it.

Lazy Lester will be backed by:
Bharath Rajakumar 
Keith Hallett
Peter Rioux 
Buck Tingley 
Bill Brennan
738765966157219.name: Lazy Lester Does Ottawa!!!! Friday May 9th,2014.

The Canadian Conference on Medical Education (CCME) is the premier medical education conference in Canada. It hosts the largest annual gathering of medical educators in the country. We also welcome our international colleagues and other partners including students, other health educators, health education researchers, administrators, licensing and credentialing organizations and governments, to come and share their experiences in medical education across the learning continuum (from undergraduate to postgraduate to continuing professional development).

La Conférence canadienne sur l'éducation médicale (CCEM) est la principale conférence sur le sujet au Canada. Il s'agit de la plus importante réunion annuelle d'éducateurs en médecine du pays. Nous accueillons aussi nos collègues internationaux et d’autres partenaires, notamment des étudiants, d’autres enseignants et chercheurs en éducation dans le domaine de la santé, des administrateurs, des représentants des ordres de médecins, des organismes de délivrance de titres et des gouvernements, à venir partager leurs expériences en éducation médicale dans tout le continuum de l’apprentissage (du niveau prédoctoral au perfectionnement professionnel continu en passant par le niveau postdoctoral).

Around the country and across the world, groups of women are coming together once a month on or near the New or Full Moon, to create a safe, nurturing, healing space by women for women. In Ottawa we are meeting on Friday following the New Moon.

Here we can gather to spend some quiet time together, share some snacks, journal or do some creative work, rest our head in a sister's laps, come to dance and move, sing our sacred songs, share our stories, educate and mentor our young daughters and sisters, listen to each other.

The Ottawa Red Tent is a 'by donation' event. Donations will be welcomed to cover expenses of room rental & supplies (suggested $7-10).

Come. Bring your mother, your sisters, your daughters (of menstruation age), and most of all yourselves. Bring your stories, your talents, your abilities, and your receptivity. The Red Tent Temple is open to all women under the common ground we share of our desire to connect, our deep caring for others and our need for taking care of ourselves. Babes in arms/nurslings also welcome.

*please also bring;
- some snacks to share 
- your own plate/bowl & cup
- anything you'd like to share with others

read more about the Red Tent Movement;

http://alisastarkweather.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=blogcategory&id=25&Itemid=48

http://www.facebook.com/RedTentsInEveryNeighborhood?ref=ts&fref=ts

753201108046782.description:
A B Series Celebrates National Poetry Month!

Readings by AMANDA EARL & DEAN STEADMAN!

With a performance of Steadman's work, APRES SATIE: FOUR TWO AND FOUR HANDS by Lesley Strutt, Frances Boyle, Alastair Larwill and Steadman. Après Satie: Four Two and Four Hands is a poetry collection inspired by Erik Satie's piano compositions.  Moody, often surreal in tone and content, the interplay of primo and secondo voices in these poems raises our awareness of the temporal nature of all things.

AMANDA EARL is the managing editor of Bywords.ca and the publisher of AngelHousePress, including its transgressive prose imprint, DevilHouse. She is the author of several chapbooks. Her first poetry book will be published by Chaudiere Books in the fall of 2014. Her poems have also appeared in literary journals both on line and in print in Australia, Canada, England, France, Ireland and the USA. Amanda has received funding from the City of Ottawa and the Ontario Arts Council. 

DEAN STEADMAN’s work has been published in Canadian journals and e-zines, as well as in the anthology Pith and Wry: Canadian Poetry (Scrivener Press, 2010).  His poem, “Crime Passionnel” (Descant 144, Spring 2009), was selected by Lorna Crozier as one of the top 100 poems in The Best Canadian Poetry in English, 2010 (Tightrope Books).  He was a finalist in the 2011 Ottawa Book Awards for his poetry collection their blue drowning (Frog Hollow Press, 2010).  His chapbook, Portrait w/tulips, was published by Leaf Editions in 2013.
753201108046782.name: EARL & STEADMAN - A B Series Celebrates National Poetry Month!

753400061346545.description:
The 2014 Ottawa Grassroots Festival (OGF) takes place April 25-27 at The Royal Canadian Legion, Montgomery Branch, at 330 Kent Street.

Friday evening places a focus on Bluegrass, with a concert by The Monroe Sisters, Concession 23, and Maple Hill!  Daytime events are free.  Saturday evening you'll enjoy a concert by the legendary James Keelaghan. 

Keelaghan, a Juno Award winning singer-songwriter, has an uncanny knack for turning incredible historical events into finely crafted songs relevant to us now. One of Canada’s most successful and respected musicians.  

Other performers over the weekend include Amanda Bon, Missy Burgess, Lyndell Montgomery, Kristin Sweetland, Gardener Ed Lawrence, Shout Sister, Katayoun Malekmotiee, and more!  

Find out more at www.ottawagrassrootsfestival.com
753400061346545.name: 3rd Annual Ottawa Grassroots Festival

756360817721701.description:
The Awakening is an invitation to a new experience of your self, your life, your friends, family and the world.

Most of what appear to be external obstacles in life are really internal ones. We complain about him or her, this or that, and convince ourselves that if things outside of ourselves would change, our experience of life would change. But our internal landscape determines our experience of the external one. Perception is not a window, it is a mirror.

This is a workshop about the spiritual dilemma that underlies and translates into the psychological drama of our daily lives. You will be presented with an internal map, based on A Course in Miracles, of the dynamics of the psychological defense system that is revolutionary and universal in application. This can be a life altering moment, delivered at the level of experience rather than restricted to intellect and insight.

The Awakening is a creative, empowering, process oriented weekend, focusing in depth on the relinquishment of a thought system based on fear for a thought system based on love.
756360817721701.location: Temple Pastures (286 Fogarty Rd, Gatineau, Quebec)
756360817721701.name: The Awakening (Ottawa)

Grre en famille

Sounds kinda like SPIRIT OF THE WEST, GREAT BIG SEA and LA BOTTINE SOURIANTE….hung out in Jamaica with MARLEY and MADNESS.

Grre en Famille is a Reggae/ Ska/ Quebecer/ French band (with some songs in English). The guitar, bass, cajon, and vocals are topped off with a touch of classical with violins, a cello giving the whole a gypsy flavour. It’s a colourful musical adventure that lends itself well to good vibes and packed dance floors.

780858415259862.description: May 24-25, 2014. Join thousands of runners from around the world during Tamarack Ottawa Race Weekend. Children, youth, and veteran runners take over Ottawa during this weekend for a number of events, including a kid’s marathon and two- and five-kilometre runs. The centrepiece of the weekend, though, is the Ottawa marathon. As the largest marathon in the country, and cited as one of the must-run routes, some of the best runners from all corners of the world enter for a chance to win this prestigious event. If watching is more your sport, the marathon passes many of Ottawa’s major landmarks, so there are plenty of great spots to watch these athletes.

781806408498820.description:
Presented by the Ottawa Burlesque Festival, Improv Burlesque: a lottery of tease is a simple concept that takes seasoned burlesque performers and turns everything upside-down and backwards for them, then puts them on stage for your entertainment.

Opening the show with an acoustic set will be our special guests, Francesca Daoust and John Muller, visiting all the way from Victoria, BC. 

With our very special host, Holly Sin.

HOW IT WORKS:
Participating performers (Burlesque and drag artists of all genders are welcome) submit their names into the lottery. 10 performers names will be drawn to participate in Improv Burlesque: a lottery of tease.
Performers who's names have been drawn will be be given a song and prop, selected on the spot, at random by lottery, and tasked with performing a completely improvised routine in the costume they showed up with.

Performers will be given 5-10 minutes to mentally prepare, make costume adjustments, and listen to their song once before going on stage to flex their improvisational muscles.

Selected performers will have 24 hours notice to stuff their drag bag with costumes (no non-wearable props allowed!) and brag all over their social media that they are participating in Ottawa's first improvisational burlesque show!

All selected performers will be given a prize from an Ottawa Burlesque Festival sponsor, for participation.

Improv Burlesque: a lottery of tease is a fundraiser to help subsidize production costs of the Ottawa Burlesque Festival.

All performers wishing to enter their name in the lottery are asked to make a donation of $5. This donation is symbolic of seriousness on behalf of the performer, and helps offset costs for OBF.  

Please submit your $5 to enter the lottery via paypal: ottawaburlesquefestival@gmail.com

Performers who put their name in but are not selected in the lottery will be offered $5 off of cover charge.


May 25, at Yuk Yuk's on Elgin
$10 cover charge 
The delicious OBF popup bake sale will be back with a melange of treats to tickle your taste buds
The always friendly Shawn will be behind the bar
DJ Lowpass will be running tunes
781806408498820.name: Improv Burlesque: a lottery of tease

864250150258493.description:
Silent Auction items will be posted and bids may be placed throughout April 1-30, 2014 via phone (613-792-1222), email (info@oicc.ca), facebook messaging, Twitter or in-person at the OICC. Have fun bidding!  
Please help us raise funds to provide subsidized care for patients who cannot afford integrative care and suffer unnecessary pain and distress.  Cancer often has a catastrophic financial impact on individuals and their families. The OICC offers subsidized care to as many people as we can, but we are a charitable not-for-profit and receive no government funding, so our capacity to do so is limited. 

There are numerous ways participating business or individuals can join in this great cause, as we are seeking organizations to provide auction item donations and the community itself to help increase awareness and donate through placing your Silent Auction bid. 
Please invite all your contacts to this Spring For Cancer event in support of Ottawa Integrative Cancer Centre - thank you & have fun bidding!
864250150258493.name: Spring For Cancer Silent Auction in support of the Ottawa Integrative Cancer Centre
